Mercury Systems Inc. demonstrates good outperformance potential with a strong GF Score, profitability, and growth rank, but also presents some financial risks.

title: Inside The RealReal’s ambitious turnaround strategy
summary: The RealReal, a luxury consignment platform, is implementing a three-part turnaround strategy under CEO John Koryl to achieve profitability after years of losses since going public. The plan involves launching an ad network, shifting its inventory focus by reducing low-value items and emphasizing jewelry/accessories, and relying more on third-party sellers to mitigate warehousing costs and increase supply. This strategy aims to leverage The RealReal's audience and meet high demand for vintage fashion while addressing its looming debt in 2025.

title: Capital Research Global Investors Acquires Significant Stake in Carrier Global Corp
summary: Capital Research Global Investors acquired over 9 million additional shares of Carrier Global Corp. on July 31, 2023, increasing their total holdings to more than 86 million shares, representing 10.30% of Carrier Global Corp.'s total shares. This significant transaction, valued at $59.55 per share, underscores Capital Research Global Investors' continued investment in the industrial company despite Carrier Global Corp. being considered modestly overvalued by GuruFocus. The investment firm, with substantial holdings in technology and healthcare, now holds a considerable stake in the HVAC and security products manufacturer.

title: YieldMax Launches Option Income Strategy ETF on Coinbase
summary: YieldMax has launched the YieldMax COIN Option Income Strategy ETF (CONY) on NYSE Arca, aiming to generate monthly income through a synthetic covered call strategy on Coinbase Global (COIN). This ETF, actively managed by ZEGA Financial, is part of a growing suite of YieldMax option income strategy ETFs focusing on growth companies that may not pay dividends. It provides investors with an opportunity to earn income and potentially protect against downside while gaining exposure to a growth company like Coinbase.

title: B. Riley Leads Financing for Management Buyout of Franchise Group
summary: B. Riley Financial announced it led the equity financing for the $2.8 billion management-led acquisition of Franchise Group, Inc. by investing $216.5 million. This marks B. Riley's second significant investment in FRG, with the initial investment in Liberty Tax (which became FRG) generating over 30% IRR for shareholders. The company also secured a new $600 million credit facility, partially used to fund the FRG investment and retire a previous credit facility.

title: Salesforce lifts annual forecast as business software demand stays strong
summary: Salesforce raised its annual revenue forecast and projected quarterly sales above estimates, benefiting from recent price hikes and strong demand for its cloud and business software. The company's shares rose, signaling optimism about a recovery in technology spending and its new AI integrations. Salesforce also increased its full-year adjusted operating margin forecast, bolstered by its first price hike in seven years.

title: The Fishbowl: Lydia Parker, Samsung Ads Europe
summary: This article features an interview with Lydia Parker, Head of International Agencies at Samsung Ads Europe, as part of The Media Leader's "Fishbowl" series. She discusses her career progression, professional experiences, leadership strategies in a hybrid work environment, changes in client conversations due to the booming CTV market, and her favorite ad.

title: 3 Online Retailers To Revamp Your Shopping List With
summary: The online retail sector, as seen through the ProShares Online Retail ETF (ONLN), is showing signs of recovery after a challenging period. With consumer confidence appearing to have bottomed out and the holiday season approaching, three online retailers are highlighted as potential additions to investors' watchlists: Amazon.com Inc (AMZN), Shopify Inc (SHOP), and Etsy Inc (ETSY). Amazon and Shopify have already seen significant rallies, while Etsy, despite recent struggles, is presented as a high-upside opportunity for risk-tolerant investors.

title: Bandwidth Partners with Google and Cognigy to Launch AIBridge, Integrating Artificial Intelligence with Contact Centers Using Maestro
summary: Bandwidth has announced a partnership with Google and Cognigy to launch AIBridge, a new capability within its Maestro platform. AIBridge enables enterprises to deploy voice-based AI tools to their contact centers, allowing for faster and more efficient call resolution in the communications cloud without direct agent intervention. This integration is designed to improve customer experience, increase agent satisfaction, and significantly reduce contact center operating costs by leveraging conversational AI from partners like Cognigy.AI and Google Cloud's Dialogflow.

title: Cineverse Horror Channel SCREAMBOX TV Launches on Amazon Freevee
summary: Cineverse Corp. has launched its horror channel, SCREAMBOX TV, on Amazon Freevee, expanding its reach to a wider audience. SCREAMBOX has become a premier and rapidly growing streaming brand in the horror genre, adding over 550 new films and TV series since its acquisition. This move aims to make top-quality horror entertainment more accessible and attractive to advertisers.

title: 2023 Entrepreneur Of The Year Winners
summary: This article highlights the 2023 Entrepreneur Of The Year winners from nine Minnesota companies, recognized through EY's Entrepreneur of the Year Awards program. It features profiles of leaders like Cheri Beranek of Clearfield Inc., Michele Henry of Face Foundrié, Patrick Hawkins of Hawkins Inc., and others, detailing their entrepreneurial journeys, company growth, financial achievements, and leadership philosophies. The entrepreneurs represent diverse industries including fiber optics, facial spas, chemical distribution, mental health services, functional beverages, airlines, sushi ventures, education technology, and RV manufacturing.

title: Amprius and Tenergy Launch New Drone Battery Pack
summary: Amprius Technologies and Tenergy have partnered to launch a new high-performance drone battery pack, unveiled at the Commercial UAV Expo. This innovative battery solution offers a 31% reduction in weight and a 6% greater energy capacity compared to competitors, featuring Amprius's high-energy density Silicon Anode Li-ion batteries. The companies anticipate this "drop-in" solution will significantly increase adoption in the Unmanned Aircraft Systems market, which is projected to reach $38 billion by 2025.

title: The 6 Best Chesterfield Sofas That'll Class Up Your Space
summary: This article reviews the 6 best Chesterfield sofas available in 2024, ranging from classic designs to modern interpretations. It explains the historical origins of the Chesterfield sofa and provides details, pros, and cons for each recommended model across various price points and styles. The piece also offers guidance on what to look for when purchasing a Chesterfield sofa, focusing on upholstery and design choices.

title: Single stock and covered call come together in ETF line
summary: A new suite of 17 ETFs from Rex Shares, called Rex IncomeMax ETFs, combines single-stock products with covered-call strategies for individual securities ranging from Amazon to Disney. These funds aim to provide downside protection and enhanced income through options contracts, targeting two popular investing trends. While some advisors praise their use as a "volatility buffer," others caution against them, advocating for more cost-effective means of managing single-stock risk.

title: Invesco MSCI USA ETF (PBUS) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the Invesco MSCI USA ETF (PBUS), including its current stock price, key statistics like PE Ratio and Dividend Yield, and its top holdings as of August 31, 2025. The ETF has a portfolio value of $8.44 billion with top holdings including NVIDIA, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, and Meta Platforms. It also presents historical performance data and breakdowns of asset allocation and sector exposure.

title: iShares MSCI ACWI ETF
summary: The iShares MSCI ACWI ETF (ACWI) offers investors global equity exposure to large and mid-capitalization developed and emerging markets. It tracks the MSCI All Country World Index, providing diversification across numerous countries and sectors efficiently. The ETF is marketed as a low-cost investment vehicle with potential for long-term growth, though it acknowledges inherent investment risks.

title: Hershey appoints its first-ever CTO
summary: The Hershey Company has appointed Deepak Bhatia as its first-ever CTO, who will also join the executive committee and report directly to CEO Michele Buck. Bhatia, previously VP of supply chain optimization at Amazon, will lead Hershey's global technology strategy, focusing on digital capabilities as the company heavily invests in its digital infrastructure, including a multiyear ERP implementation set to finish in 2024. These investments are part of Hershey's strategy to expand analytics and automation amid rising corporate expenses due to technology and capability enhancements.

title: Oracle says it's ready to cater to Canadian banks' open banking needs
summary: Oracle has declared its readiness to support Canadian banks with their open banking requirements, offering technology solutions as Canada implements its framework. Oracle's executive vice president for financial services, Sonny Singh, noted that the company's existing financial products, used globally, are well-positioned for this shift. This comes as Canadian banks are increasingly partnering with fintech firms and Oracle, despite recent market value losses due to strong cloud-computing competition.

title: Oracle spends more than $100 million on Ampere chips
summary: Oracle Corp has agreed to prepay $104.1 million for processor chips from startup Ampere Computing and also invested $400 million in Ampere in its fiscal 2023. This investment and chip purchases are intended to give Oracle's cloud services a competitive edge against rivals like Amazon.com and Google, which develop their own server chips. Ampere designs custom server chips based on Arm technology, competing with Intel and Advanced Micro Devices.

title: What Market Pros Saw Last Earnings Season That Spurred Investments in Tech and AI Stocks
summary: Market experts, managing over $67 billion, analyzed second-quarter earnings reports and concluded that the bull market has room to run, a U.S. recession is unlikely, consumer spending remains strong, and AI is not in a bubble but rather a significant driver of corporate profits. They identified key sectors and companies benefiting from current growth trends, including broad-market strength beyond AI and Big Tech, and a re-emerging strong momentum in European economies.

title: Should Vanguard Russell 1000 Growth ETF (VONG) Be on Your Investing Radar?
summary: This article evaluates the Vanguard Russell 1000 Growth ETF (VONG) as a potential investment, highlighting its focus on large-cap growth stocks, low expense ratio, and strong performance. It details VONG's sector exposure, top holdings, and risk profile, while also suggesting alternative ETFs for consideration.

title: Arlo Introduces Second Generation Of Essential Cameras And Doorbells
summary: Arlo Technologies has launched the second generation of its Essential cameras and doorbells, including the Essential XL Outdoor Camera, Essential Indoor Camera, and a new Video Doorbell. These new devices offer improved battery life, resolution options up to 2K, and seamless integration with smart home platforms like Google Assistant and Amazon Alexa. The products are designed to provide enhanced smart home security with features such as color night vision, integrated sirens, and automated privacy shields, and are available for pre-sale now.

title: How Traeger Grills Improved Customer Experience Through Cloud-Based Contact Centers
summary: Traeger Grills transformed its customer experience by leveraging Amazon Connect and IoT data to improve first call resolution (FCR) and customer satisfaction (CSAT). Corey Savory, VP Global Customer Experience & Service, describes how data-driven insights, AI, and tools like Loupe enhance diagnostic accuracy, reduce warranty spend, and optimize agent performance. The company has seen significant improvements, including a 75% FCR and 94% Top Box CSAT, by focusing on proactive issue resolution and continuous training using cloud-based contact center solutions.

title: Blue Apron to be sold to delivery startup Wonder Group in $103M deal
summary: Blue Apron announced its acquisition by food-delivery startup Wonder Group for $103 million, a significant drop from its 2017 IPO valuation of nearly $2 billion. Stockholders will receive $13 per share, a 137% premium. Wonder, owned by Marc Lore, plans to integrate Blue Apron into its operations, furthering Lore's goal of creating a "super-app" for meal times.

title: Best Buy joins growing list of retailers entering the healthcare space
summary: Best Buy has entered the healthcare sector by offering a continuous glucose monitoring system, becoming the latest retailer to expand into medical services. Other major retailers like Costco, Amazon, Walmart, and CVS have also significantly invested in healthcare, providing services ranging from virtual primary care and online pharmacies to in-store clinics and health insurance. This trend highlights a broader movement among large retailers to diversify their offerings and tap into the growing healthcare market.

title: Amex pilots biometrics in online checkout
summary: American Express is piloting facial and fingerprint recognition for its SafeKey fraud prevention service in online checkout. The company is testing these biometric capabilities with a fraction of its U.S. consumer cardholders before a broader rollout early next year, aiming to mitigate fraud and simplify the online shopping experience. This move comes as consumers seek faster and more secure authentication methods beyond traditional passwords and PINs.

title: Moat Investing Rises Above Magnificent Seven Dominance
summary: The article discusses how Morningstar's Moat Index outperformed the S&P 500 year-to-date despite being underweight the "Magnificent Seven" mega-cap stocks. It highlights the growing concentration risk posed by these seven technology giants and explains how equal-weighted Moat strategies offer a solution through diversification and attractive valuations. The article also details the September index reconstitutions for both the Moat and SMID Moat Indexes, noting shifts away from growth stocks and into more value-oriented sectors.

title: Amazon, McDonald's, Chuck E. Cheese and InterContinental Hotels Group respond to Trafficking Inc. investigation
summary: Amazon, McDonald's, Chuck E. Cheese, and InterContinental Hotels Group have responded to allegations of repressive labor practices at their Persian Gulf outlets, brought forth by the "Trafficking Inc." investigation. The investigation by ICIJ, Guardian US, NBC News, and Arab Reporters for Investigative Journalism documented migrant laborers' claims of coercion, exorbitant recruiting fees, passport confiscation, and restricted freedom to leave jobs, practices widely identified as labor trafficking indicators. Each company issued statements outlining their policies, commitments to human rights, and steps to address the findings, with Amazon already implementing a compliance plan with a third-party vendor implicated in violations.

title: Stagwell (STGW) Acquires Left Field Labs, Deepening Technology Capabilities in AI, Digital Transformation and Immersive Experiences
summary: Stagwell (NASDAQ: STGW) has acquired Left Field Labs, a digital agency specializing in AI, digital transformation, and immersive experiences, to enhance its technology capabilities. Left Field Labs will join Stagwell's Constellation Network, bringing end-to-end services and expertise in human-centric design to guide clients. This acquisition marks Stagwell's third in 2023, reinforcing its strategy to lead AI-based digital transformation in marketing.

title: IWF ETF: Be Cautious Of High Valuations (NYSEARCA:IWF)
summary: The iShares Russell 1000 Growth ETF (IWF) tracks large-cap U.S. growth stocks and has its largest holdings in Apple and Microsoft. While it generally underperformed some growth ETFs like QQQ, it surpassed others like SPDR Portfolio S&P 500 Growth ETF due to differences in its holdings and sector exposure. The article advises caution due to potentially high valuations.

title: Generative AI Delivers a Boost to Cloud Computing
summary: Cloud computing companies are experiencing a rebound after a difficult period, driven by improving fundamentals and the increasing importance of generative AI. Spending on cloud computing is projected to rise by nearly 22% in 2023, and cloud providers are capitalizing on this trend by integrating AI-incorporated solutions and monetizing AI-as-a-service. This surge in AI adoption is expected to lead to better-than-expected revenue and profit growth for companies in the cloud computing sector.

title: Gartner Identifies the Top 10 Strategic Technology Trends for 2024
summary: Gartner has announced its top 10 strategic technology trends for 2024, emphasizing the need for organizations to act boldly amidst technological disruptions and socioeconomic uncertainties. The trends, presented at Gartner IT Symposium/Xpo 2023, highlight the increasing role of AI, sustainability, and intelligent automation in driving business value and resilience. Key themes include the democratization of Generative AI, AI Trust, Risk and Security Management, AI-Augmented Development, and the emergence of Machine Customers and Industry Cloud Platforms.

title: JD.com: Fair Value Slashed by 51% to USD 43; Our Order of Preference is PDD, Alibaba, and JD.com
summary: Morningstar has significantly cut its fair value estimate for JD.com by 51% to USD 43 per ADS, citing a longer-than-expected transition to a low-price strategy and increased competition. The forecast for JD's 10-year revenue and non-GAAP net profit CAGRs has also been reduced. Morningstar's order of preference for e-commerce companies in China now stands as PDD Holdings, Alibaba, and JD.com.

title: Stanford’s AI transparency index shows foundational models are shrouded in secrecy
summary: A Stanford University report reveals that most popular foundational AI models from companies like OpenAI, Google, and Meta lack transparency regarding their development and societal impact. Meta's Llama 2 topped the transparency index, while OpenAI's GPT-4 scored lower despite extensive public information from partners, indicating that open-source models generally lead in transparency. The researchers highlight the need for greater disclosure to inform policymakers and foster trust in AI, especially as regulations like the EU's Artificial Intelligence Act emerge.

title: Retail Sales Rise 0.7% in September, Stronger Than Expected
summary: U.S. retail sales increased by 0.7% in September, exceeding the anticipated 0.3% growth and marking the sixth consecutive month of consumer spending increases. Core retail sales (excluding autos) also rose by 0.6%, surpassing the 0.2% forecast. Control purchases, a more reliable economic indicator, also saw a 0.6% increase, indicating stronger-than-expected consumer activity.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Franklin Templeton Optimistic About Emerging Markets
summary: Chetan Sehgal, lead portfolio manager of Templeton Emerging Markets Investment Trust (TEMIT) and senior managing director at Franklin Templeton, expresses optimism about emerging markets, citing digitalization, high-tech firms, and renewable energy. He highlights strong performance in South Korea, Taiwan, and India, with specific stock picks like PAYTM, Policy Bazaar, and Zomato. Sehgal also sees recovery in Brazil and stabilization in China's economy, emphasizing the increasing awareness and improvement in ESG issues across emerging markets.

title: After Earnings, Is Netflix Stock a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Netflix delivered strong Q3 earnings with significant subscriber additions and robust margins, attributed in part to password-sharing crackdowns and advertising revenue growth. Despite this strength, Morningstar believes Netflix (NFLX) stock is fairly valued at $350 per share, acknowledging that some recent tailwinds like subscriber boosts from the crackdown and high free cash flow due to production strikes may subside. The company maintains a narrow economic moat due to its large subscriber base and data-driven content strategy, but faces risks from content costs, international market challenges, and increasing competition.

title: Top 10 Cloud Security Companies
summary: The cloud-managed services market is projected to reach US$164 billion by 2027, driven by increasing enterprise demand and a lack of IT expertise, while cloud security is poised for substantial growth to US$170.51 billion by 2032 due to rising cyber threats. This article lists the top 10 cloud security companies in 2023, based on market capitalization, including industry giants like Microsoft, Alphabet, and Amazon, highlighting their key offerings and recent developments in cloud security. The companies presented offer diverse solutions, from comprehensive cloud platforms and cybersecurity infrastructure to data analytics and application security.

title: Microsoft Edged Out Its Cloud Computing Competitors in Q3
summary: Microsoft's cloud computing service, Azure, reported 29% growth in Q3, outperforming competitors Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services, largely due to strong demand for its AI capabilities. The article suggests inverse ETFs like MSFU, CLDL, and UBOT for traders looking to capitalize on Microsoft's continued competitiveness in cloud computing and the growth potential of AI. Microsoft's significant investment in OpenAI contributed to a 13% revenue jump, highlighting its strategic focus on integrating AI across its technology stack.

title: Will AI Spark a Boom in Data Centre Real Estate?
summary: The article discusses how the rise of AI and other disruptive technologies is driving an increase in demand for data centers, potentially tripling global capacity in six years. It highlights data center real estate stocks, such as Digital Realty Trust and Global X's Data Centre REITs & Digital Infrastructure ETF, as a focused investment opportunity, noting their inflation-resistant nature and tax benefits. The article also touches on the geographical shift in data center placement, with growth in less expensive locations like the US Midwest.

title: Hartford Funds Seeks to Let $4.1B Fund Make More Concentrated Investments
summary: Hartford Funds is proposing to reclassify its $4.1 billion Growth Opportunities Fund as a non-diversified investment, which would allow it to make more concentrated investments. This change, if approved by shareholders, would increase the fund's risk profile and volatility, prompting plan sponsors and fiduciaries to re-evaluate their inclusion of the fund in retirement lineups. The reclassification comes as allocations to a few mega-cap tech stocks have pushed some diversified funds to exceed investment thresholds.

title: Bilibili Announces Most Popular Scientific Topics of 2023 among China's Young Generations
summary: Bilibili announced the "2023 Top 5 Most Popular Scientific Topics on Bilibili" among young Chinese generations, including AIGC, room-temperature superconductors, brain-computer interfaces, black holes, and controllable nuclear fusion. The platform hosted a "Super Science Night" event featuring renowned scientists and Bilibili creators to engage young audiences with science. Science and knowledge-related content is the second most searched category on Bilibili, accounting for 41% of total viewing time, with over 243 million users viewing such content in the past year.

title: The Magnificent 7 In Other Countries (Emerging Markets X-China)
summary: This article identifies seven emerging market companies (outside of China) that could become the "next Magnificent 7" in technology, similar to the dominant tech giants in developed markets. It highlights companies from Latin America, India, and Southeast Asia, spanning fintech, e-commerce, and digital services, and details their unique strategies, market positions, and growth potential. The author emphasizes a long-term perspective on these companies' appreciation and their role in the global technology landscape.

title: Westinghouse / Cameco And Brookfield Complete $8.2 Billion Acquisition
summary: Canada-based uranium company Cameco, in partnership with Brookfield Asset Management and its Brookfield Renewable Partners affiliate, has completed the acquisition of Westinghouse Electric for $8.2 billion. Cameco now holds a 49% interest, while Brookfield owns 51% of Westinghouse, a major nuclear services provider. This acquisition is expected to enhance Cameco’s participation in the nuclear fuel cycle amidst growing momentum for nuclear energy.

title: Social Media’s Abuzz About Stocks in These ETFs
summary: The article discusses how social media platforms like Instagram and TikTok influence investing trends, particularly among younger investors. It highlights that while the quality of advice is debatable, social sentiment investing is becoming more prevalent. The Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) and the Invesco NASDAQ 100 ETF (QQQM) are presented as options for investors seeking exposure to stocks frequently discussed on these platforms, with several of their holdings ranking high in social media mentions.

title: Booking.com settles Italian tax dispute with 94-million euro payment
summary: Travel website Booking.com has agreed to pay approximately 94 million euros ($100.25 million) to settle a tax dispute in Italy covering the period from 2013 to 2021. The settlement follows an investigation by Genoa prosecutors into the company's handling of VAT on properties rented through its platform. As part of the agreement, Booking.com also filed its VAT return in Italy for 2022 and committed to acting as a tax substitute for transactions with private individuals not registered for VAT.

title: FAANG Gives Way to the ‘Magnificent Seven’
summary: The "FAANG" stock group has evolved into the "Magnificent Seven," with Netflix replaced by Nvidia, and Microsoft and Tesla added to the mix of top U.S. market names. ETF issuers are beginning to launch products specifically targeting these seven stocks, while existing ETFs like the Vanguard Mega Cap Growth ETF (MGK) already hold significant concentrations of them. Investors have various options, from highly concentrated ETFs to diversified funds, to gain exposure to these influential companies.

title: Amazon integrates same-day grocery delivery, loyalty with Weis Markets
summary: Amazon is expanding its same-day grocery delivery partnership with Weis Markets to additional cities in New Jersey, Virginia, Pennsylvania, and Maryland. The expansion includes integrating the Weis Markets Rewards loyalty program directly into Amazon's platform, allowing customers to earn points on their Amazon orders. This move aims to enhance Amazon's grocery shopping experience, offering more selection, value, and convenience to both Prime and non-Prime members.

title: FMR LLC Acquires New Stake in Magenta Therapeutics Inc
summary: FMR LLC, through its flagship company Fidelity Investments, has acquired a new stake in Magenta Therapeutics Inc (MGTA) by purchasing 2,218,212 shares at $0.6996 per share. This transaction gives FMR LLC a 14.97% ownership stake in the clinical-stage biotechnology company, indicating a strategic investment aligning with the firm's focus on technology and healthcare sectors. Despite Magenta Therapeutics currently operating at a loss, FMR LLC's move suggests a belief in the company's long-term value and transformative potential in stem cell and gene therapy.

title: Amazon adds Weis Markets to its site, begins delivery
summary: Amazon has partnered with Weis Markets to offer the grocer's products on its platform with same-day delivery in New Jersey, Virginia, Pennsylvania, and Maryland. This collaboration also integrates the Amazon loyalty program with Weis Rewards, providing deals to customers. Amazon aims to expand its grocery delivery offerings by teaming up with more third-party retailers.

title: Belden Expands Data Solutions with the Belden Horizon Software Suite
summary: Belden Inc. has expanded its data engineering capabilities with the Belden Horizon software suite, designed to converge real-time IT/OT data, simplify data collection and integration, and provide actionable insights through edge computing. The suite integrates with AWS Industrial Data Fabric and features products like Belden Horizon Data Operations, Belden Horizon Data Manager, and Belden Horizon Console to enhance operational efficiency and predictive insights for industrial verticals. Belden will showcase the suite at AWS re:Invent 2023, emphasizing its ability to break down data silos and enable scalable cloud computing.

title: Should You Buy the Invesco QQQ ETF With the Nasdaq At An All-Time High? History Offers a Clear Answer.
summary: This article discusses the Invesco QQQ ETF and whether it's a good investment despite the Nasdaq Composite being at an all-time high. It analyzes historical data of the Nasdaq's performance after reaching new highs, suggesting that further gains are common. The article concludes that dollar-cost averaging into QQQ is a sensible strategy regardless of market highs, as it tracks the Nasdaq 100 which tends to rise over time.

title: Spain's watchdog clears Amazon, Booking.com, Tripadvisor over fake reviews
summary: Spain's antitrust watchdog, CNMC, has cleared Amazon, Booking.com, and Tripadvisor of involvement in or facilitation of fake reviews on their platforms, noting the companies' efforts to detect and combat such reviews. However, the watchdog identified potential violations of consumer protection regulations and referred the complaint to the consumer rights authority. The original complaint cited possible instances of sellers and intermediaries offering money or products for fake reviews, falling under consumer protection purview.

title: Which Cloud Stocks are Benefitting from the AI Boom?
summary: Despite cloud computing being fundamental to AI programs, some cloud funds, like WisdomTree’s Cloud Computing Fund, have not fully capitalized on the AI rally. This article explores why emerging cloud stocks have lagged, highlighting that the primary beneficiaries are the major cloud infrastructure providers such as Amazon, Microsoft, and Google, which are part of the "Magnificent Seven" and have seen significant gains. It also discusses how these cloud leaders are preparing for future demands from generative AI and quantum computing through increased capital expenditure and strategic partnerships.

title: Which Cloud Stocks are Benefitting from the AI Boom?
summary: While cloud computing is fundamental to AI, some cloud-focused funds have underperformed despite the AI rally, suggesting a potential future bounce. The global cloud infrastructure market is dominated by Amazon, Microsoft, and Google, who are heavily investing in capacity and partnerships for generative AI. These "Magnificent Seven" companies have shown significant gains driven by the AI boom, indicating that the benefits of the AI-cloud synergy are largely accruing to the major infrastructure providers.

title: Salesforce soars 8% as cost cutting shows its ‘brand new religion’ to increase profits
summary: Salesforce stock soared over 8% after announcing a profit forecast that exceeded analyst estimates, driven by its aggressive cost-cutting measures, including workforce reductions and a focus on increasing profit margins. CEO Marc Benioff's strategy, dubbed a "brand new religion," has pleased Wall Street despite some concerns about revenue growth, as the company integrates acquisitions and introduces AI features.

title: AI ETFs see huge performance dispersion in 2023
summary: Artificial Intelligence ETFs have shown significant performance dispersion in 2023, with top strategies more than doubling the returns of the lowest performers. This disparity is largely attributed to the heavy weighting of certain ETFs towards US equities and the "magnificent seven" tech stocks. While these mega-cap companies have driven much of the AI theme's returns, there is still potential for pure-play AI companies to join the rally.

title: Staples Counting on Discounts for the Remainder of 2023
summary: Despite a strong Black Friday, the author suggests a nuanced approach to the retail sector for Q4 2023, advising investors to focus on online retail ETFs and discount retailers/staples ETFs due to anticipated consumer weakness. The article highlights that e-commerce continues to gain market share and that discount retailers like Walmart and Costco are well-positioned to benefit as consumers seek savings on essential goods. It concludes that while online retail ETFs might experience some weakness, the broader consumer staples sector, particularly discount retailers, is likely to show strength.

title: WaterWorld - Retail sector resurgence: optimism grows for holiday momentum
summary: The retail sector saw a strong start to the holiday shopping season with $38 billion in online spending over Thanksgiving weekend, exceeding projections and boosting optimism. This surge, a 7.8% increase in Cyber Week spending, has positively impacted the SPDR S&P 500 Retail ETF (XRT), which has risen significantly. Key holdings like Carvana, Signet Jewelers, and Kohl’s are contributing to this momentum, suggesting a continued strong performance into the holiday season.

title: Reborn Coffee makes its international debut with Malaysia outlet
summary: Reborn Coffee has opened its first international outlet in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, marking its international debut. The new store will serve as a launchpad for expansion into Singapore and Indonesia, led by the newly formed subsidiary Reborn Coffee Malaysia. This expansion, alongside new locations in California, South Korea, and the UAE, is expected to significantly augment revenue streams for the company.

title: Celestica stock rides another tech wave – but can it avoid a crash this time?
summary: Celestica Inc., a Toronto-based manufacturer, is experiencing a resurgence due to the AI boom, supplying equipment to data centers for major tech companies like Amazon, Google, and Meta. Despite a significant increase in stock price and revenue, questions remain about the sustainability of this growth compared to the company's past crash during the dot-com era. CEO Rob Mionis argues that Celestica is a more diversified and insulated company now, focusing on higher-margin, complex equipment and seeing sustained demand in the early stages of AI development.

title: 8 Retail Stocks Whose Price and Fundamentals Don’t Line Up
summary: This article discusses eight retail stocks where the market price does not align with the underlying financial fundamentals, particularly following a significant stock market rally. It suggests that some recent gains in these stocks might be less stable than others.

title: Amazon’s 2023 Black Friday week observed sales rose, while big-box retailers showed mixed results
summary: During the 2023 Black Friday week, Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ: AMZN) saw a double-digit increase in observed U.S. sales year-over-year, while big-box retailers like Walmart, Target, and Best Buy experienced mixed results. Walmart Inc (NYSE: WMT) maintained the largest market share among the analyzed companies, but Amazon's share grew the most year-over-year. The article highlights how Black Friday sales performed amidst consumer spending jitters due to factors like student loan resumptions and higher interest rates.

title: Why Investors Should Keep An Eye on Small-Cap Stocks
summary: This article discusses how the increasing concentration of market-cap-weighted indexes, particularly driven by large-cap tech stocks, is creating historical levels of concentration. It explores the implications for the size premium, suggesting that higher market concentration leads to increased expected returns for small-cap stocks due to capital misallocation and reduced investor demand for smaller firms, making them an attractive area for investors.

title: CastleArk Enters ETF Market With Large Growth ETF CARK
summary: CastleArk has launched its first exchange-traded fund, the CastleArk Large Growth ETF (CARK), an actively managed ETF focused on large-cap growth companies. The fund targets 25-30 leading growth companies, identifying competitive strength and seeking to optimize risk through quantitative inputs. CastleArk aims to provide an actively managed alternative to index-heavy portfolios, especially given the concentration of "Magnificent Seven" stocks in the large-cap growth sector.

title: When parents have child care problems, companies have labor force problems
summary: Tyson Foods has invested nearly $5 million in an on-site child care center near its Humboldt, Tennessee, plant to attract and retain workers, addressing the lack of affordable child care in rural areas. This pilot program, which subsidizes care to an average of $1.66 per hour for parents, allows shift workers like Tiffany Butler to rejoin the workforce and demonstrates a "sticky benefit" for employee retention. While beneficial for participating employees, critics like Elliot Haspel point out the limitation of employment-linked child care benefits for gig workers and others without traditional employers.

title: BigBear.ai Stock Is High Risk, High Reward (NYSE:BBAI)
summary: BigBear.ai Holdings, Inc. (BBAI) is presented as a high-risk, high-reward investment opportunity due to its algorithmic decision intelligence solutions and expansion into various sectors including supply chains, logistics, autonomous systems, and cyber intelligence. The company has shown mixed operational results but achieved its first net income positive quarter (not from operations) and possesses a significant backlog, with efforts to grow in the visual AI market. This article, written by Quad 7 Capital, suggests BBAI merits consideration for its speculative potential.

title: They Made ‘Sound of Freedom’ a Hit — But Were They Deceiving Their Audience?
summary: Angel Studios, the distributor of the hit film 'Sound of Freedom,' is facing scrutiny over its business practices, including its crowdfunding and "Pay It Forward" ticketing campaigns. Filmmaker Ashley Bratcher and legal experts allege that the studio's methods, controlled by the Harmon family, may violate financial regulations and exploit small donors and creative partners. Questions are being raised about the transparency and legality of the financial structure that allowed 'Sound of Freedom' to become a blockbuster while potentially benefiting Angel Studios' investors more than crowdfunders or filmmakers.

title: Why Is Freight Technologies (FRGT) Stock Up 120% Today?
summary: Freight Technologies (FRGT) stock surged over 120% today following the announcement of a new agreement with Amazon (AMZN) Mexico. This deal marks the second year Amazon Mexico will utilize Freight Technologies' Fr8App platform for its logistics needs, particularly for shipping between distribution centers during the busy holiday season. The news led to significant trading volume for FRGT stock.

title: ‘Asian Amazon’ Coupang rescues Farfetch with $500 million deal
summary: South Korean e-commerce giant Coupang has acquired British luxury marketplace Farfetch in a deal worth $500 million, rescuing the struggling retailer from potential insolvency. This acquisition will take Farfetch private, removing its publicly traded shares. The deal is seen as a strategic move for Coupang to expand its footprint in the luxury goods market, particularly in South Korea where per-capita spending on luxury items is high, and to increase its presence in the US.

title: Meta: Sell it? Buy it?
summary: Meta's stock price has experienced significant volatility in recent years, oscillating from a high of $384 in August 2021 to below $100 in October 2022, before rebounding to around $340. This article explores the company's journey from being considered a "sell" to a "buy," focusing on challenges such as Apple's privacy policy changes and competition from TikTok, and how Meta has responded by investing heavily in AI and re-evaluating its metaverse strategy. The future success of Meta is tied to its AI applications across its businesses, especially in advertising and new ventures.

title: After Narrowly Avoiding a Collapse, What Happened to Farfetch?
summary: Farfetch, the luxury e-commerce platform, recently secured a $500 million rescue deal from Korean e-commerce giant Coupang to avoid bankruptcy. The company's stock price plummeted from a February 2021 high of $73 to $0.64 by December 2023, reflecting years of financial woes, including significant cash burn and a departure from its core marketplace model. Despite a boost from the COVID-19 pandemic and initial media support, analysts and investors eventually raised concerns about its spending, valuation, and business viability, leading to its current precarious situation.

title: Megatrends: How to Invest in the AI Boom
summary: This article from Morgan Stanley discusses investment opportunities in the rapidly growing artificial intelligence (AI) industry, projected to reach $3 trillion. It identifies four types of AI leaders for investors to watch: Margin Expanders, Trailblazers, Price Raisers, and Input Suppliers, while also cautioning about potential risks and the need for selective investing.

title: T. Rowe Price Capital Appreciation Equity ETF (TCAF): A Promising Active Fund
summary: The T. Rowe Price Capital Appreciation Equity ETF (TCAF) has shown significant growth since its launch in June 2023, accumulating over $600 million in assets. The fund focuses on high-quality U.S. large-cap companies, employing a bottom-up stock selection approach with top holdings like Apple, Microsoft, and Amazon. TCAF's investment philosophy emphasizes strong performance in areas like technology, healthcare, and consumer discretionary.

title: Apple's stock underperformed top tech peers in 2023 due to longest revenue slide in 22 years
summary: Apple's stock underperformed its mega-cap tech peers in 2023, experiencing its longest revenue slide in 22 years with four consecutive quarters of declining sales. This decline was attributed to a combination of a weak economic environment for smartphones and PCs, and company-specific issues such as the lack of new iPad models and an Apple Watch sales ban. Despite a 49% stock rally for the year, Apple lagged behind competitors like Nvidia, Meta, Tesla, Amazon, Alphabet, and Microsoft.

title: Markets in Focus: Concentrating on Diversification
summary: The article discusses the increasing concentration in equity markets, exemplified by the "Magnificent Seven" stocks, and the diminished diversification benefits of bonds, especially since 2020. It suggests that investors reassess top-down allocations and broaden equity exposure across diverse regions, sectors, and styles to create more resilient portfolios. The MSCI Adaptive Multi-Factor Allocation Model indicates an overweight to value and low size as of December 31, 2023, with Europe and China trading at lower historical valuations.

title: RDE, Inc. (Restaurant.com) Completes Acquisition of CardCash.com, Creating $100 Million+ Incentives Business
summary: RDE, Inc. (Restaurant.com) has announced the completion of its acquisition of CardCash.com, creating a combined incentives business with over $100 million in revenue in 2023. This acquisition significantly expands RDE's cross-selling opportunities and offers Restaurant.com customers a wider range of discounted gift card options across various industries. The integration is expected to provide customers with unprecedented savings on gift card purchases, leveraging digital technology for instant exchange or access to discounted gift cards.

title: GigaCloud Grows
summary: Despite global supply chain disruptions, GigaCloud Technology Inc. reported a successful year, marked by record revenue, a new headquarters in El Monte, and two significant acquisitions. The company aims to be the leading B2B e-commerce marketplace for large parcel items, leveraging a risk-pooling model and extensive transportation network. GigaCloud posted substantial third-quarter gains, including $24.2 million in net income and $178 million in revenue, and made strategic acquisitions of Apexis Inc. and Noble House Home Furnishings LLC to further its market position.

title: SKYX’s All-in-One Smart Platform is Everything from a Smart Speaker to a Smoke Detector
summary: SKYX Platforms Corp. debuted its patented All-in-One Smart Platform at CES 2024, aiming to make existing homes technologically advanced. This platform integrates multiple smart home features like a smoke/CO detector, smart speaker, Wi-Fi repeater, and various lighting controls, all controllable via app and voice commands. The product installs easily into a ceiling and supports major smart home ecosystems, with SKYX also renewing a global licensing agreement with GE.

title: Dolby Showcases the Growing Reach of Dolby Vision and Dolby Atmos at CES 2024
summary: Dolby Laboratories showcased the expanding presence of Dolby Vision and Dolby Atmos at CES 2024, highlighting new collaborations in automotive entertainment with Mercedes-Benz and Lotus, and advancements in home audio with Dolby Atmos FlexConnect supported by Hisense and TCL. The company also announced the integration of Dolby Vision into gaming PC monitors from Alienware and ASUS, underscoring its commitment to delivering immersive audio and video experiences across various devices.

title: eBay to pay $3M after employees sent live spiders, cockroaches to couple
summary: eBay has been ordered to pay $3 million after its employees engaged in a harassment and intimidation campaign against a Massachusetts couple. The campaign involved sending live spiders, cockroaches, and other disturbing items, triggered by the couple's online newsletter coverage of eBay. The company entered into a deferred prosecution agreement, which could lead to charges being dismissed if conditions are met.

title: FedEx Challenges Amazon with Homegrown Marketplace
summary: FedEx is launching its own digital marketplace, fdx, to compete with Amazon by leveraging its extensive logistics infrastructure and shipping data. This move allows FedEx to monetize its delivery metadata by connecting merchants with customers, similar to how Amazon used customer behavior data to fuel its growth. The platform aims to serve both retail and B2B sellers, mirroring the evolution of Amazon's marketplace.

title: Netflix Tests Streaming Deal with Carrefour to Boost Subscribers (NFLX)
summary: Netflix is piloting a joint subscription plan with French retailer Carrefour to increase subscribers for its ad-supported tier. This initiative offers customers in Bordeaux and Rouen a discounted Netflix subscription along with benefits on Carrefour products and free shipping for orders over €60. The trial aims to replicate Amazon's success in bundling services to attract more streaming customers and may expand across France if successful.

title: Unlocking The Potential Of Pure Research At InterDigital
summary: This article examines InterDigital's role as a pure research facility, led by CEO Liren Chen, and its significant contributions to wireless technology, including current work on 5G advanced and future plans for 6G with AI integration. It highlights InterDigital's impressive growth, long-standing partnerships with companies like Apple and Amazon, and its unique approach to fostering innovation among its largely inventor-based workforce. Chen emphasizes the importance of curiosity, competency, and impact in driving both individual and company success, showcasing InterDigital's continued influence on global digital communication.

title: Monday.com review: Work management platform works best when you pay for it
summary: This review offers an in-depth look at Monday.com, a versatile "Work OS" designed for project management, process monitoring, and team collaboration. While it excels in power, flexibility, and ease of use, the review highlights that its full potential and most compelling features are unlocked in its paid tiers. The analysis covers pricing, core features like intelligent tables and integrations, low-code programming capabilities, and its workflow advantages compared to rivals, ultimately recommending the Standard tier for its value.

title: JFrog-Amazon SageMaker integration aims to streamline machine learning workflows
summary: JFrog announced a new integration with Amazon SageMaker to enhance machine learning workflows. This partnership aims to streamline the building, training, and deployment of ML models by incorporating DevSecOps best practices, ensuring models are immutable, traceable, secure, and compliant within a modern software development lifecycle. The integration also introduces capabilities for detecting malicious models, scanning licenses, and improving transparency and control through robust access controls and versioning.

title: Billionaire couple gives Spelman College largest-ever single donation to an HBCU
summary: Billionaire Ronda Stryker and her husband William Johnston have donated $100 million to Spelman College, marking the largest-ever single donation to a Historically Black College and University (HBCU). The funds will primarily support scholarships ($75 million), with the remainder allocated to developing an academic focus on public policy and democracy, and improving student housing. This donation is part of a larger trend of increased giving to HBCUs following racial justice protests, and highlights Spelman's strong endowment compared to other HBCUs.

title: Your S&P 500 Index Fund Has Higher Risk Than You May Think
summary: This article argues that the S&P 500 index fund, traditionally seen as diversified, now carries higher risk due to its concentration in a few technology stocks. It highlights concentration, valuation, and inflation risks, suggesting investors re-evaluate their S&P 500 holdings and consider more value-oriented, truly diversified investments.

title: AES positioned to provide tech sector with growing renewable energy solutions
summary: AES Corp. is strategically positioned to be a leading provider of renewable energy solutions to the technology sector, especially given the rising power demands from data centers and generative AI. The company focuses on long-term contracted revenues with credit-worthy partners and offers customized solutions to meet the unique sustainability goals of major tech firms like Google, Microsoft, Amazon, and Meta. With significant growth projected in key markets and a strong track record of project execution, AES aims to capitalize on the increasing demand for clean energy in the tech industry.

title: Higher S&P 500 Earnings Could Benefit This Active ETF
summary: The NEOS S&P 500 High Income ETF (SPYI) is poised to benefit from expected higher corporate earnings in 2024, as forecasted by Goldman Sachs. SPYI, an actively managed ETF, focuses on call options and holds "Magnificent Seven" stocks, offering investors tailor-made holdings, risk mitigation, and tax-efficient monthly income. Its active management removes the need for constant supervision and provides a single solution for a core equity portfolio.

title: NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) Stock Rocketed Over 200% in 2023
summary: Polen Capital's "Polen Focus Growth Strategy" fund saw significant returns in 2023, with NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) being a key contributor as its stock rocketed over 200%. The article highlights NVIDIA's crucial role in the generative AI boom, providing the processing power for large language models and AI factories. NVIDIA was held by 180 hedge fund portfolios at the end of Q3 2023, up from 175 in the previous quarter.

title: eBay cutting 1,000 jobs, will reduce contract workforce
summary: eBay is cutting approximately 1,000 full-time jobs, representing about 9% of its workforce, and will also reduce its contract workforce to become more nimble and efficient. CEO Jamie Iannone stated that the company's headcount and expenses had outpaced business growth, despite strategic progress. This move follows similar workforce reductions by other major e-commerce retailers like Amazon and Wayfair amidst a cooling e-commerce boom.

title: AT&T's Q4 Profit Likely Fell as Subscriber Growth Slowed
summary: AT&T's Q4 profit is expected to have declined due to rising service and sales costs, despite a marginal revenue increase and persistent subscriber growth, albeit at a slower rate. Bank of America suggests that the company's stock underperformed last year despite strong operational performance, but anticipates improved performance in 2024 due to reduced capital spending and expanding cash flow.

title: Online retailer eBay is cutting 1,000 jobs. It’s the latest tech company to reduce its workforce
summary: Online retailer eBay is cutting approximately 1,000 jobs, or 9% of its full-time workforce, citing that its employee count and costs have outpaced its business growth in a slowing economy. This move follows a trend of layoffs across the tech industry, where companies that rapidly expanded during the COVID-19 pandemic are now trimming expenses. CEO Jamie Iannone informed employees that the company will also reduce its alternate workforce contracts and highlighted the need for better organization and nimbleness.

title: eBay Stock Surges After Saying It Will Cut 9% of Its Workforce—Monitor These Key Levels
summary: eBay announced plans to cut 9% of its workforce, or 1,000 jobs, which led to a nearly 3% surge in its stock price. CEO Jamie Iannone stated that the company's headcount and expenses had outpaced business growth. The article also provides key technical levels for investors to monitor eBay's stock performance within a descending channel pattern.

title: Analog Devices finds permanent CFO from Amazon Web Services
summary: Analog Devices has appointed Richard Puccio, formerly CFO of Amazon Web Services, as its new permanent Chief Financial Officer. Puccio served as AWS's CFO for almost three years before joining the Wilmington-based semiconductor firm. This appointment follows previous reports regarding Analog Devices' search for a permanent CFO.

title: Analog Devices Appoints Richard C. Puccio, Jr. as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
summary: Analog Devices, Inc. (ADI) announced the appointment of Richard C. Puccio, Jr. as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, effective February 5, 2024. Mr. Puccio, formerly CFO at Amazon Web Services (AWS) and a partner at PwC, will lead ADI's global finance operations and financial strategy. His extensive experience in technology sectors is expected to accelerate ADI's operational effectiveness and shareholder value.

title: Historic $10B planned investment to benefit Entergy Mississippi customers
summary: Entergy Mississippi announced a historic $10 billion investment by Amazon Web Services (AWS) in Mississippi will bring new jobs and economic development, while supporting long-term power reliability and affordability for all Entergy Mississippi customers. This significant capital investment, finalized by Mississippi lawmakers, is expected to help keep electricity rates lower and drive advancements in the power grid and generation across the state. Entergy Mississippi, which serves 461,000 customers in 45 counties, emphasized its readiness to support AWS and other growing companies, highlighting its century-long commitment to providing reliable power.

title: Amazon.com Inc. stock outperforms competitors on strong trading day
summary: Amazon.com Inc. (AMZN) stock rose 0.87% to $159.12 on Friday, marking its fourth consecutive day of gains. This performance occurred on a mixed trading day where the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) increased by 0.16% and the S&P 500 Index (SPX) fell by 0.07%. The article highlights Amazon's strong individual performance relative to broader market trends.

title: Amazon taps Kueski for buy now, pay later service in Mexico
summary: Amazon Mexico has partnered with venture capital-backed fintech Kueski Inc. to offer a buy now, pay later service, Kueski Pay, allowing customers to pay in bi-weekly installments without needing a credit card. This initiative addresses the large unbanked population in Mexico and expands flexible payment options for Amazon customers. Kueski, a leading BNPL provider in Latin America, has secured over $300 million in funding for its services.

title: Amazon, Roomba-parent iRobot abandon $1.4 billion merger deal
summary: Amazon and iRobot have abandoned their $1.4 billion merger deal due to opposition from EU and U.S. antitrust regulators. iRobot announced a significant restructuring, including cutting 350 jobs and the stepping down of its CEO, Colin Angle, while Amazon will pay iRobot a $94 million termination fee. Regulators were concerned Amazon could use the acquisition to hinder iRobot's rivals on its online marketplace.

title: Why global corporations are attracted to Palm Beach County, Florida
summary: Palm Beach County, Florida, is attracting numerous international corporations and financial institutions due to its diversified economy, top-notch educational and health care facilities, safety, and substantial tax benefits. The county also offers excellent location and transportation links, including a high-speed Brightline train, and has a strong economic development organization, the Business Development Board (BDB), supporting business growth.

title: Walmart plans to add more than 150 large-format stores across the U.S.
summary: Walmart plans to open more than 150 large-format stores, including conversions and new constructions, across the U.S. over the next five years. This expansion signals Walmart's commitment to its brick-and-mortar presence, despite growing online competition, and comes as the company continues to outperform other retailers by attracting a broader customer base. The new stores will feature a modern design with sustainability features and updated technology.

title: Plug Power Completes First Customer Fill of Liquid Green Hydrogen at its Georgia Plant
summary: Plug Power has successfully completed the first customer fill of liquid green hydrogen produced at its Woodbine, Georgia plant, with the hydrogen being transported to sites for Walmart, Amazon, and Home Depot. This milestone follows the official commencement of operations at the plant, which houses the largest proton exchange membrane (PEM) electrolyzer deployment in the U.S. The Georgia plant can produce up to 15 tons per day of liquid green hydrogen, demonstrating a significant step towards a cost-effective green hydrogen economy.

title: Markets Brief: Will the ‘Magnificent Seven’ Stocks Keep Carrying the Market After Earnings?
summary: The article analyzes the performance of the "Magnificent Seven" stocks after their latest earnings reports, noting that while most beat forecasts, market reactions were mixed due to high expectations. It discusses whether these tech giants can continue to drive market gains in 2024, given their current valuations and the potential for a broader market rally. The article also provides a detailed recap of individual company performances and analyst commentary.

title: Apple, Skechers fall; Amazon, Deckers Outdoor rise, Friday, 2/2/2024
summary: On Friday, February 2, 2024, several major stocks experienced significant price changes. Apple and Skechers saw declines due to lukewarm forecasts, while Amazon, Deckers Outdoor, Meta Platforms, and Clorox rose following strong financial results or optimistic outlooks. Microchip Technology and Columbia Sportswear also faced drops after giving disappointing forecasts.

title: Why US large cap growth’s banner year didn’t look the same across index providers
summary: This article explains why US large-cap growth index performance varied significantly among providers in 2023, despite a banner year for the segment. The key differentiator is methodology, particularly how factors like momentum influence constituent classification, as exemplified by Meta's stock performance. Different index construction rules lead to varying index compositions and thus different returns.

title: Ingles Sees Net Sales, Income Decline in Q1
summary: Ingles Markets Inc. reported declines in net sales and net income for Q1 of its fiscal 2024, with net sales decreasing by 0.8% to $1.48 billion and net income falling to $43.4 million. Despite increased operating expenses, the regional grocer managed to narrow its total debt to $546.9 million. The company asserts its financial resources are sufficient to meet future capital expenditures, debt service, and working capital needs.

title: Exclusive: Cisco to cut thousands of jobs as it seeks to focus on high growth areas
summary: Cisco is reportedly planning to restructure its business, which will involve laying off thousands of employees to focus on high-growth areas. An announcement could come as early as next week, ahead of its earnings call on Feb. 14. This move follows a previous restructuring in late 2022 and comes as many other tech companies are also cutting jobs.

title: Vistra Corp (NYSE:VST) Surges Amidst AI Energy Boom and Nuclear Expansion
summary: Vistra Corp (NYSE:VST) has seen its stock surge over 200% year-to-date, fueled by the increasing demand for power from AI and data centers, as well as strategic expansions in nuclear energy. The company's acquisition of Energy Harbor significantly boosted its nuclear capacity, and its strong financial performance, insider confidence, and alignment with clean energy policies position it for continued growth, with analysts maintaining a bullish outlook.

title: Real Estate Giant CoStar Group Chooses Arlington for its Headquarters
summary: CoStar Group, a global real estate information and marketplace provider, is moving its headquarters to Rosslyn, Arlington, purchasing 1201 Wilson Boulevard. This move is expected to bring 650 workers to Arlington and significantly contribute to the local economy. The company's nearly $14 million payment to Arlington County for exclusive use of the Observation Deck at 1201 Wilson Boulevard will expedite the reconstruction of Rosslyn’s Gateway Park by almost a decade.

title: BREAKING: Arlington lands HQ of another publicly traded company
summary: CoStar Group, a publicly traded real estate information and analytics provider, is moving its corporate headquarters from Washington D.C. to Arlington, Virginia. The move to the Central Place building in Rosslyn will bring 650 employees and involves nearly $5 million in state economic incentives and a $14 million payment to Arlington County for exclusive use of an observation deck. This relocation continues Arlington's streak of attracting major company headquarters.

title: Relx Share Price Spiked Up 3% but Later Fell on FY 2023 Results
summary: Relx PLC announced strong FY 2023 financial results, reporting an 8% organic revenue growth to £9,161 million and a 13% organic adjusted operating profit increase to £3,030 million. The company proposed an 8% higher full-year dividend of 58.8p per share. Despite an initial 3% spike in its share price, it later fell, trading at 3430.5p.

title: Chase Coleman's Tiger Global Management Reduces Stake in ATRenew Inc
summary: Chase Coleman's Tiger Global Management has reduced its stake in ATRenew Inc (RERE) by selling over 3.8 million shares, representing a 33.33% decrease in its holdings. This transaction lowers ATRenew Inc's portfolio presence to 0.06% and reflects a strategic adjustment for Tiger Global, which typically focuses on larger technology and communication services companies. Despite ATRenew Inc having stable financial health, its poor profitability and growth prospects, coupled with a significant stock price decline, likely influenced Coleman's decision.

title: Amazon.com Inc. stock outperforms competitors despite losses on the day
summary: Amazon.com Inc. (AMZN) stock experienced a slight dip of 0.17% on Friday, closing at $169.51, amid a generally down market where the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average also fell. This marked the second consecutive day of losses for Amazon's stock. Despite these declines, the article headline suggests that Amazon's stock performed better relative to its competitors during this period.

title: Amazon.com Inc. stock outperforms competitors despite losses on the day
summary: Amazon.com Inc. stock (AMZN) closed down 0.17% on Friday at $169.51, marking its second consecutive day of losses. Despite the dip, Amazon's performance still outperformed the broader market, as both the S&P 500 Index and Dow Jones Industrial Average experienced larger declines on what was a generally dismal trading day.

title: Capital One Archives
summary: This article compiles various news updates related to Capital One, highlighting its activities in fintech, partnerships, and product innovations. Key events include Capital One's planned acquisition of Discover, collaborations with fraud prevention specialists like Signifyd, participation in the FedNow Instant Payments Pilot Program, and advancements in mobile banking and payment services. The article showcases Capital One's continuous efforts in digital transformation and strategic growth within the financial industry.

title: CrowdStrike's Surge Pulls This Cloud Computing ETF Higher
summary: CrowdStrike's stock surge, driven by increasing demand for cloud-based cybersecurity solutions, is significantly benefiting the Direxion Daily Cloud Computing Bull 2X Shares ETF (CLDL). Analysts are optimistic about CrowdStrike's continued growth, with HSBC setting a $411 price target. As CrowdStrike is CLDL's top holding and the ETF aims for 200% daily performance of the Indxx USA Cloud Computing Index, its strong revenue growth is expected to further boost CLDL's performance.

title: DigitalOcean beats expectations under the helm of new CEO Paddy Srinivasan
summary: DigitalOcean Holdings Inc. exceeded earnings and revenue expectations for the last quarter and provided optimistic guidance for the current quarter, leading to a stock surge. The company, under new CEO Paddy Srinivasan, is strategically focusing on AI solutions for small businesses, utilizing its Paperspace platform to offer Nvidia H100 GPUs, and demonstrating strong growth in its annual revenue run rate and average revenue per customer. Despite a slowdown in growth in the final quarter, analysts believe AI will be a key strategy for rekindling growth under the new leadership.

title: SPY First ETF to Reach $500B in Assets
summary: The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) made history by becoming the first ETF to reach $500 billion in assets under management. This milestone follows the S&P 500 surpassing the 5,000 mark, driven by strong performance from large technology companies. Despite significant outflows, the fund's liquidity and broad investor base are cited as key drivers of its growth.

title: What's Cathie Wood been selling?
summary: Cathie Wood's Ark Investment Management has sold shares of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Corp. and Nvidia Corp., diversifying holdings amidst the AI frenzy. This marks Wood's first sale of TSMC stock in over two years and follows previous sales of Nvidia. The move comes as both TSMC and Nvidia have seen significant gains, with Wood's funds betting on growth potential in less-talked-about software companies like UiPath and Twilio, despite earlier predictions of AI's transformative impact.

title: NANC ETF Tracking Democrat Stock Trades Beating S&P 500 on Tech Bets
summary: The Unusual Whales Democratic ETF (NANC), which tracks stock trades by Democrats in Congress, has outperformed the S&P 500 since its launch in February 2023, returning 30% compared to the S&P 500's 24%. This outperformance is largely attributed to its significant holdings in mega-cap tech stocks like Microsoft, Amazon, Apple, and Nvidia. In contrast, a similar ETF tracking Republican trades (KRUZ) has only gained about 15% over the same period.

title: eBay Among Top S&P 500 Gainers With 8% Surge on Buoyant Results, Buyback Plan
summary: eBay's shares surged 8% after reporting better-than-forecast fourth-quarter results, including adjusted EPS of $1.07 and revenue of $2.56 billion. The company also announced an increased quarterly dividend and a $2 billion boost to its share buyback program. Despite competitive pressures and macroeconomic challenges, eBay provided an optimistic outlook for the current quarter, with expected adjusted EPS between $1.19 and $1.23.

title: VONG ETF: A Great Way to Invest in Top Growth Stocks
summary: The Vanguard Russell 1000 Growth ETF (VONG) offers a straightforward and effective way to invest in a diverse range of top growth stocks. With a strong track record of impressive returns, a low expense ratio of 0.08%, and a portfolio that includes leading mega-cap technology companies and other high-growth firms, VONG is considered a compelling option for investors seeking exposure to large-cap growth in the U.S. market. The ETF's holdings are highly rated, with many featuring Outperform-equivalent Smart Scores.

title: The Rise of Humanoids, Explained
summary: This article discusses the rapid advancements and growing market potential of humanoid robots, driven by technological convergence of robotics and AI, and decreasing hardware costs. It highlights how humanoids are poised for mainstream adoption in industrial and household settings, potentially creating a multi-trillion dollar market by 2035, and identifies investment opportunities across the supply chain. The piece also details the challenges and improvements needed for widespread adoption, comparing the trajectory of humanoids to that of early automobiles and collaborative robots.

title: Magnificent Seven vs. the ‘Granolas’: How does Europe’s version stack up?
summary: This article compares the U.S. "Magnificent Seven" stocks with Europe's "Granolas," highlighting their differences in market value, sector diversity, and profitability. While the Magnificent Seven are largely tech-driven and exceptionally profitable, the Granolas offer broader sector representation and solid returns, often trading at a discount despite their strong performance. The piece examines historical returns, valuation ratios, and individual stock assessments for both groups.

title: Phase II of Willow Grove Shopping Center construction complete: Amazon Fresh, other tenants on the way
summary: Phase II of the Willow Grove Shopping Center's construction is complete, with Amazon Fresh still planning to open in the space. A Dave's Hot Chicken restaurant will also be a tenant, while three to four other tenants are yet to be announced. Developer Federal Realty Investment Trust described the 211,000 square-foot shopping center, which will feature new walkways, public amenities, outdoor dining, and an 18,000 square-foot outparcel building.

title: ‘Funflation’ & Technology Driving Music Industry Resurgence
summary: The music industry is experiencing a resurgence fueled by "funflation" (increased spending on live events) and technological advancements such as streaming, AI, and blockchain. Record-breaking attendance at concerts, rising streaming subscriptions, and innovation are driving growth for companies like Live Nation, Universal Music, and Warner Music Group. The MUSQ ETF offers a pure-play investment into this evolving and increasingly monetized global music market.

title: Target launches a $49 subscription service for customers wanting quick delivery
summary: Target is launching a new paid subscription service called Target Circle 360, offering same-day delivery starting at an introductory price of $49 annually. This move positions Target in deeper competition with similar services from Amazon and Walmart, betting on consumer demand for convenience despite a crowded subscription market. Analysts suggest Target may need to add more perks beyond quick delivery to attract and retain members.

title: Target Starts $49 Membership Program to Compete With Amazon, Walmart
summary: Target Corp. is launching "Target Circle 360," a new paid membership program offering unlimited free same-day delivery for orders over $35 and free two-day shipping. The program, priced at a promotional rate of $49 annually, aims to compete with established membership programs from Amazon and Walmart. Target is also rebranding its RedCard as the Target Circle Card and expanding its existing free loyalty program.

title: SCHX: As Cheap As It Gets For Large-Cap Exposure
summary: This article recommends the Schwab U.S. Large-Cap ETF (SCHX) for investors seeking exposure to large-cap stocks, highlighting its diversification, low costs, and tax efficiency. Key holdings include tech giants like Microsoft and Apple, leading to significant exposure to the Information Technology sector. The author, Michael A. Gayed, CFA, discusses market efficiency and offers insights from his Lead-Lag Report service.

title: Megacap tech stocks dominate many ESG funds. Here’s why
summary: Megacap tech stocks frequently dominate ESG funds because these funds still aim for top performers within economic groups, and the tech sector is considered "cleaner" regarding environmental impact. While ESG funds saw net outflows in Q4 2023 due to advisors pulling back, individual investor interest remains strong, viewing ESG as a long-term allocation strategy rather than a momentum play. Despite misconceptions, ESG funds can and do invest in energy companies, as explained by experts from DWS Group and former VettaFi.

title: 1How AI Enabled Smart Carts Can Bring Retail Into The 21st Century
summary: This article explores how AI-enabled smart carts can revolutionize the retail industry by addressing challenges like labor shortages, theft, and the demand for personalized shopping experiences. Despite past failures and slow adoption, new innovations in smart cart technology are making them more affordable, user-friendly, and capable of integrating with in-store media and CRM systems. The author suggests that these advancements, combined with aligning market conditions and a focus on positive user experience, could finally push smart carts into widespread use, potentially replacing self-checkout stations and funding adoption through new revenue channels.

title: Code and Theory, a Stagwell (STGW) Network Company, Named Ad Age Business Transformation Agency of the Year
summary: Code and Theory, a Stagwell (STGW) network company, has been named Ad Age Business Transformation Agency of the Year due to its technology-first approach and ability to drive significant results for clients. The agency is unique in its equal balance of engineers and creatives, which provides a competitive advantage in building brands, experiences, platforms, and capabilities to accelerate growth. They have achieved notable successes with clients like Amazon Ads, YETI, and Con Edison, distinguishing themselves through innovative partnerships and a focus on technology-led creative solutions.

title: 15 Best eBay Alternatives to Try in 2024
summary: This article lists the 15 best eBay alternatives for 2024, discussing why eBay is a popular choice for sellers and introducing other major e-commerce platforms like Walmart, Amazon, and Target. It also provides a detailed ranking of 15 alternatives based on site visits, including information on their offerings and seller programs.

title: Veritone launches AI-powered digital evidence management system
summary: Veritone has launched its new AI-powered Intelligent Digital Evidence Management System (iDEMS) to modernize digital evidence management for public safety and judicial agencies. The system extracts valuable data, automates workflows from data silos into a secure, centralized AI-driven platform, and integrates with leading industry software. Built on Veritone’s aiWARE and hosted on AWS, iDEMS centralizes digital evidence, streamlines redaction, improves analysis, and tracks persons of interest across various media types.

title: AT&T agrees to purchase carbon credits from Occidental's 1PointFive
summary: AT&T has agreed to purchase carbon dioxide removal credits from Occidental's 1PointFive as part of its goal to achieve carbon neutrality by 2035. The credits will come from 1PointFive's Stratos direct air capture facility currently under construction in Texas, which is designed to capture up to 500,000 metric tons of carbon dioxide annually. This agreement follows similar deals 1PointFive has made with other major companies like Amazon.

title: Democratic ETF outpaces Republican peer on Big Tech bets
summary: An exchange-traded fund tracking Democratic lawmakers' stock trades has significantly outperformed a Republican-oriented fund since its launch last year, driven by strategic investments in megacap technology companies like Nvidia and Microsoft. The Democratic ETF, called NANC, has surged nearly 35%, benefiting from its tilt towards growth stocks, while the Republican ETF, KRUZ, which favors energy and value stocks, gained 18.1%. This performance gap highlights the differing investment strategies based on political affiliations and coincides with growing scrutiny over congressional stock trading.

title: Nasdaq listing is a strategic move aimed at bringing value to Noventiq: CEO Hervé Tessler
summary: Noventiq CEO Hervé Tessler discusses the company's strategic move to list on Nasdaq from the London Stock Exchange, highlighting the benefits of increased access to capital and enhanced brand prestige. He emphasizes Noventiq's strong presence in emerging markets, its partnerships with tech giants like Microsoft and AWS, and its focus on digital transformation, cybersecurity, and AI solutions. Tessler also addresses challenges like navigating diverse global regulations and the imperative for continuous innovation in the rapidly evolving technology sector.

title: First over-the-counter birth control pill now for sale online
summary: Opill, the first oral contraceptive pill available without a prescription in the U.S., is now for sale online and will soon be in stores. Manufactured by Perrigo, the progestin-only pill costs $19.99 for a month's supply and is 98% effective when taken correctly. This marks a significant accessibility improvement for pregnancy prevention, especially for those who face barriers to seeing a healthcare provider.

title: Gaia Launches Gaia+, the World’s Most Extensive Streaming Platform for Transformation
summary: Gaia, Inc. has launched Gaia+, an enhanced streaming platform offering over 8,000 documentaries and series focused on transformation, spiritual growth, and consciousness expansion. This new platform provides access to immersive workshops, live events, and guided programs led by expert teachers. Gaia+ aims to empower its community with resources for personal development, stress alleviation, and abundance manifestation, available across various mobile and connected TV devices.
