title: Impact Shares YWCA Women’s Empowerment ETF (WOMN) Reaches $50M in Assets Under Management
summary: The Impact Shares YWCA Women’s Empowerment ETF ($WOMN) has surpassed $50 million in Assets Under Management (AUM), demonstrating investor interest in socially conscious funds. This ETF provides broad market exposure to U.S. companies promoting gender equity, with all net advisory profits donated to the YWCA to support its mission. The partnership between Impact Shares, Tidal Financial Group, and the YWCA highlights an innovative approach to aligning financial returns with social impact.

title: Get to know QQQ: Charting 25 years of performance
summary: The article celebrates 25 years of the Invesco QQQ ETF, tracing its evolution from its launch in 1999 to becoming one of the largest ETFs today. It highlights key milestones such as reaching significant assets under management (AUM), changes in sponsorship and naming, and its consistent outperformance compared to the S&P 500. QQQ is presented as a proven way for investors to gain exposure to highly innovative, non-financial companies listed on the Nasdaq-100 Index.

title: Tejon Ranch CEO to Leave after 2024
summary: Gregory Bielli, president and CEO of Tejon Ranch Company (TRC), announced his retirement at the end of 2024 after more than a decade in the role. Under his leadership, TRC saw significant growth, including the integration of planning and development for its mixed-use master plans, and the addition of 5.5 million square feet of industrial and commercial space in the Tejon Ranch Commerce Center. Bielli will continue as a senior adviser through 2025 and retain his board seat to assist with the leadership transition.

title: Northrop Grumman awards 70 suppliers for delivering excellence
summary: Northrop Grumman recognized over 70 suppliers for their outstanding contributions in 2023 across four categories: Performance Excellence, Quality Excellence, Strategic Excellence, and Resilience Excellence. These awards highlight the crucial role of strong supplier relationships in achieving performance, quality, and technology leadership for customer mission success. The company emphasized its partners' dedication to speed, affordability, and overall excellence.

title: S&P Global Commodity Insights and Amazon Web Services Empower Digital Transformation in Upstream Oil & Gas Industry
summary: S&P Global Commodity Insights and Amazon Web Services (AWS) are collaborating to accelerate digital transformation in the upstream oil and gas industry. This partnership will provide energy companies with access to comprehensive upstream data on AWS Data Exchange and facilitate the development of cloud-based AI and machine learning tools, as well as access to S&P Global Commodity Insights' Kingdom™ Geoscience Software. The initiative aims to enhance decision-making, efficiency, and data interoperability for energy companies, supporting both traditional operations and the energy transition.

title: DWS social fairness SDG ETF: Screened rather than thematic impact
summary: DWS has launched the Xtrackers MSCI Global SDGs Social Fairness Contributors UCITS ETF (XDGS) which targets social fairness SDGs. While the ETF uses broad screening criteria to identify companies with positive contributions to social fairness, some experts question if it truly achieves "impact" by focusing on large companies in socially relevant sectors rather than those directly addressing social good for underserved populations. The article highlights that active management might be better suited for genuine impact investing in social SDGs.

title: Proven Retail Winners: IKEA, Williams Sonoma, Crate + Barrel
summary: This article analyzes the performance of home furnishings retailers, identifying IKEA, Williams Sonoma, and Crate & Barrel as proven winners demonstrating adaptability and strong brand attributes despite economic challenges. It contrasts their success with Wayfair, which is presented as a potential loser due to operational challenges, declining revenue, and lack of brand differentiation. The article highlights how the successful companies have leveraged unified commerce, design differentiation, and solution-based selling to thrive.

title: A new product allows 5x leveraged bets on the Magnificent Seven. Traders should be wary.
summary: A new exchange-traded product allows investors to make 5x leveraged bets on the Magnificent Seven group of stocks, raising concerns among analysts. While levered exchange-traded products are gaining popularity, traders are warned about the significant risks associated with such highly leveraged instruments. ETF analyst Todd Sohn from Strategas Securities notes that this product appears to be the most heavily levered available in any developed market.

title: Pixie Dust Technologies “kikippa” Speaker Ranked First on the Rakuten Sound Bar Ranking
summary: Pixie Dust Technologies' "kikippa" speaker achieved the top position on the Rakuten Sound Bar Ranking in February 2024. The speaker, which processes and outputs "gamma wave sound" with 40Hz modulation, is widely distributed on major e-commerce platforms. This recognition on Rakuten, a prominent Japanese online marketplace, significantly boosts the product's visibility and market acceptance.

title: Esports Investing: Opportunities & Strategies
summary: Esports is a rapidly growing industry with significant investment opportunities despite its relative newness. Investors can gain exposure through companies involved in game development, streaming platforms, hardware/software manufacturing, or through dedicated esports ETFs. While growth prospects are strong, investors should be prepared for volatility and perform thorough due diligence.

title: F5 Networks (FFIV) Appoints Kunal Anand as Chief Technology Officer
summary: F5, Inc. announced the appointment of Kunal Anand as Executive Vice President and Chief Technology Officer (CTO), alongside Lyra Schramm as Executive Vice President and Chief People Officer (CPO). Anand will be responsible for F5's technology vision, leveraging his expertise in cybersecurity and data to accelerate the company's leadership in application and API security. Schramm will focus on driving people initiatives and fostering an innovative workplace culture.

title: VanEck Retail ETF: The Landscape May Turn (NASDAQ:RTH)
summary: The VanEck Retail ETF (RTH), which invests in 25 prominent retailers, has outperformed its benchmark over the last six months. However, the author raises concerns that this outperformance may not continue, citing potential issues which could affect its trajectory and suggesting the risk-reward profile is not currently ideal.

title: Costco offering members access to weight-loss programs including medication
summary: Costco Wholesale is expanding its partnership with online healthcare provider Sesame to offer its members access to weight-loss programs, including prescriptions for drugs like Ozempic and Wegovy. Members can subscribe to Sesame's weight-loss program for a discounted rate, with clinicians providing guidance on diet and lifestyle, and potentially prescribing medication, though the subscription does not cover medication costs. This move follows similar healthcare service offerings from other major retailers like Amazon and Walmart, as demand for GLP-1 protagonist drugs continues to surge.

title: Alger Launches 2 Transparent Actively Managed ETFs
summary: Fred Alger Management has launched two new transparent actively managed ETFs: the Alger AI Enablers & Adopters ETF (ALAI) and the Alger Concentrated Equity ETF (CNEQ). ALAI focuses on companies involved with artificial intelligence, while CNEQ invests in large-cap growth companies, with a significant allocation to technology. These additions bring Alger's ETF family to five funds, building on their earlier entry into the ETF market in 2021.

title: As Amazon's stock hovers near a record, its bonds are also looking attractive
summary: Amazon's bonds are becoming attractive to investors as their yields have increased since the beginning of the year, tracking Treasury yields. The company's bonds are highly rated (A1 by Moody's, AA- by S&P) and one specific note with a May 2028 maturity has seen its yield climb to 4.71%, offering a solid return. Amazon currently holds over $66 billion in outstanding bonds, with a significant portion maturing in 2027.

title: As Amazon's stock hovers near a record, its bonds are also looking attractive
summary: Amazon's stock is nearing an all-time high, but its corporate bonds are also presenting an attractive opportunity due to increased yields. These higher yields are attributed to movements in Treasury yields, not credit issues, as the bonds hold strong ratings from Moody's and S&P Global Ratings. The company has over $66 billion in outstanding bonds, with a significant portion maturing in 2027.

title: Prevention through Design (PtD) Award
summary: The Prevention through Design (PtD) Award, presented by NIOSH and partners, recognizes individuals, teams, and organizations for eliminating or reducing hazards through design efforts or contributing to the body of knowledge enabling PtD solutions. Nominations are due the first weekday of March and highlight successful implementations of PtD principles, with recent winners including Bruce Main and Jacobs Solutions in 2024. The article details the award criteria, nomination process, and provides examples of past awardees and honorable mentions, showcasing diverse PtD applications.

title: Amazon appears to be moving forward with long-planned delivery station
summary: Amazon.com Inc. has received approval to build a $73 million last-mile delivery station in Round Rock, an Austin suburb. The project is expected to create up to 200 jobs and construction is slated to begin by the end of the year, with completion within 12 months. The site may also include a future data center.

title: Implications of AI for cloud computing companies
summary: The article explores the significant impact of AI on cloud computing companies, noting that while AI has driven much of the equity market's recent gains, particularly for the "magnificent seven" tech companies, the broader economic benefits may take time to materialize. It highlights cloud computing as a key beneficiary, where AI integration can enhance operational efficiency, decision-making, cybersecurity, and personalized services. The piece also introduces the Fidelity Cloud Computing UCITS ETF as a means for investors to gain exposure to this theme.

title: Birmingham-area stocks pace gainers
summary: Birmingham-area stocks experienced moderate gains on Thursday, leading the local stock market. First US Bancshares, ProAssurance, and Warrior Met Coal were among the top performers. Amazon also saw a record high, reaching $189.05 a share.

title: Abbott Laboratories to close Bay Area site; almost 200 jobs to be cut
summary: Abbott Laboratories is closing its Fairfield, California location later this year, leading to the layoff of 195 employees. The company, known for brands like Similac and Pedialyte, attributed a decrease in its annual sales to an anticipated decline in COVID-19 testing-related sales, despite overall sales growth in the fourth quarter. Fairfield Mayor Cathrine Moy expressed frustration over the timing of the layoffs and the company's decision to discontinue the nutritional bar previously made at the plant.

title: Akamai expands cloud services with dedicated GPUs for media workloads
summary: Akamai Technologies Inc. has launched a new industry-optimized cloud service utilizing Nvidia RTX 4000 Ada generation GPUs, specifically designed for media workloads to enhance video encoding, decoding, and processing. This service aims to provide faster and more cost-effective solutions for media providers compared to standard virtual machines, leveraging Akamai's global edge network. Although optimized for media, the service is also capable of supporting other demanding tasks like generative AI training and inference.

title: Infinium and Kinetik Reach Innovative CO2 Utilization Agreement to Advance eFuels Production
summary: Infinium and Kinetik Holdings Inc. have formed a long-term agreement for Infinium to purchase captured carbon dioxide from Kinetik's Permian Basin operations. This CO2 will be used as a feedstock for Infinium's Project Roadrunner, which produces ultra-low carbon electrofuels (eFuels) including sustainable aviation fuel (eSAF), marking a new model for decarbonization in heavy transport and chemical industries. This partnership aims to significantly reduce lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions and repurpose waste CO2, showcasing a beneficial reuse solution within the energy sector.

title: Amazon Prime Memberships in US Gain 8% to New High
summary: Amazon's Prime subscription service reached a new high of 180 million U.S. shoppers in March, an 8% increase from the previous year, according to Consumer Intelligence Research Partners. This growth indicates strong appeal for Amazon's fast delivery, despite inflation and increased online competition. Analysts project a 12% gain in Amazon's subscription services revenue for the period ended March 31.

title: J.P. Morgan Chase, Amazon, Wells Fargo among LinkedIn’s Top Companies of 2024
summary: J.P. Morgan Chase & Co., Amazon, Wells Fargo, Deloitte, and PwC lead LinkedIn's 8th annual Top Companies list for 2024, highlighting 50 best large workplaces in the U.S. The list is compiled using LinkedIn data to measure career success based on promotion rates and skill development. This year's honorees are recognized for their investment in employee experience, including upskilling initiatives and flexible working arrangements.

title: Cisco debuts new AI-focused security system after $28 billion deal to buy Splunk
summary: Cisco launched HyperShield, a new AI-focused security product, after its $28 billion acquisition of Splunk, aiming to protect applications, devices, and data across various IT environments. The technology is designed to address the challenges posed by new digital AI assistants like ChatGPT and improve vulnerability patching times from days to minutes. This move is part of Cisco's strategy to become a serious AI player and boost its cybersecurity business as it faces competition in its traditional market.

title: How to Find Cloud Software Company Stocks to Trade and Invest
summary: This article provides guidance on investing in cloud computing stocks, detailing different types of cloud services (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) and key factors influencing stock performance like market demand and financial health. It offers investment strategies, including individual stocks (e.g., ServiceNow, Zoom) and ETFs (e.g., Global X Cloud Computing ETF), and lists major players like Amazon, Microsoft, and Adobe in the cloud software industry.

title: Hyperscale data center capacity to double every four years - report
summary: A new report by Synergy Research Group indicates that hyperscale data center capacity will double every four years for the next decade, driven primarily by demand for cloud services and AI tools. The number of active hyperscale facilities has surpassed 1,000 globally, with AI accelerating the scale of new data centers. The US accounts for 51 percent of worldwide capacity, while Amazon, Microsoft, and Google collectively represent 60 percent of all hyperscale data center capacity.

title: HanesBrands Announces Substantial Progress Toward Reaching Sustainability Goals Around People, Planet and Product
summary: HanesBrands Inc. announced significant progress toward its 2025/2030 sustainability goals in its 2023 Sustainability Summary Report, encompassing People, Planet, and Product pillars. The company has reduced greenhouse gas emissions by 53% since 2019 and aims for zero waste by 2025 and 100% renewable electricity by 2030. HanesBrands has also recognized substantial savings from its sustainability investments and advanced efforts to improve lives globally.

title: PCA’s corrugated product shipments rise as demand rebounds
summary: Packaging Corporation of America (PCA) saw corrugated product shipments rise in Q1 2024, exceeding expectations due to a rebound in demand across all sectors and the end of customer destocking. Despite positive volume trends, executives expressed frustration with Fastmarkets RISI’s pricing index not fully reflecting announced price increases. PCA also reopened paper machines earlier than planned and expects a Q2 financial impact from scheduled maintenance.

title: Graham Holdings moving headquarters to trophy high-rise building in Rosslyn
summary: Graham Holdings, the company that previously owned The Washington Post, is relocating its corporate headquarters to a 35-story trophy building at 1812 N. Moore Street in Rosslyn, Virginia. The company has signed a 15-year lease for the entire 21st floor of the building, which also houses Nestle USA's headquarters. This move highlights the strong demand for Class A and top-tier office spaces in the D.C. area, despite high overall vacancy rates.

title: 6 Questions For Adam Singolda, Founder & CEO, Taboola
summary: Adam Singolda, founder and CEO of Taboola, discusses the company's evolution from its inception in 2007 to its current position as a public company nearing $2 billion in revenue. He elaborates on the strategic partnership with Yahoo, the integral role of AI in Taboola's business model, and how the company is navigating the phasing out of third-party cookies. Singolda also addresses challenges faced by news publishers and highlights Taboola's Turnkey Commerce initiative, including its partnership with the Associated Press.

title: Microsoft Reports Rising Revenues as A.I. Investments Bear Fruit (Published 2024)
summary: Microsoft announced a 17% increase in revenue and a 20% rise in profit for the first three months of the year, driven significantly by its investments in artificial intelligence and strong growth in its cloud computing product, Azure. The company's A.I. services, particularly in generative A.I., contributed to a 31% growth in Azure sales and helped Microsoft gain market share from Amazon. Microsoft also saw substantial growth in its gaming division, boosted by the acquisition of Activision Blizzard, and better-than-expected performance in Windows software sales as the PC market stabilized.

title: Newegg creates free membership program, offering perks to participants
summary: Newegg has launched Newegg+, a free customer membership program offering perks such as free shipping, expedited returns, and exclusive deals. The electronics retailer aims to enhance the shopping experience and gather customer feedback to expand the program in the future. This initiative aligns with the growing trend of loyalty programs among Top 1000 retailers, which are used to gather data and drive customer behavior.

title: HRH the Hereditary Grand Duke and Xavier Bettel on a working visit to the United States
summary: HRH the Hereditary Grand Duke and Minister for Foreign Affairs and Foreign Trade, Xavier Bettel, conducted a working visit to the United States, including Detroit, Cleveland, New York, and Delaware, to deepen relations with American industrial investors in Luxembourg. The visit focused on the space economy, with Minister Bettel emphasizing cooperation and sustainability in space, and culminated in the 11th Luxembourg-American Business Award being presented to Redwire for its contributions to the space industry. The delegation also met with executives from Redwire, AIAC, and DuPont.

title: Sundar Pichai confirms Alphabet Inc. is going to issue first-ever dividend, $70 billion buyback - Hindustan Times
summary: Alphabet Inc., Google's parent company, announced its first-ever cash dividend of 20 cents per share and a new $70 billion stock repurchase program following strong Q1 2024 earnings. CEO Sundar Pichai highlighted robust performance from Search, YouTube, and Cloud, attributing success to the "Gemini era" and AI leadership. This move, similar to Meta's recent dividend, signals tech industry maturity and has been positively received by investors.

title: Fox’s New Ad-Sales Chief Will Tout Tom Brady, Super Bowl LIX in TV Upfront
summary: Fox's new ad-sales chief, Jeff Collins, plans to leverage the upcoming Super Bowl LIX broadcast and Tom Brady's debut as an NFL announcer to attract advertisers during the annual TV upfront market. Collins emphasizes Fox's strategy of focusing on being "best in class" and offering distinct audiences across its diverse media portfolio, including broadcast, sports, Fox News, and Tubi, to counter market pressures from streaming services. He anticipates strong demand for Super Bowl LIX ad slots, despite increasing competition in the advertising landscape.

title: How to Buy Alphabet (Google) Stock Online in 2025
summary: This article provides a comprehensive guide on how to buy Alphabet (Google) stock online in 2025, detailing steps, top brokers, and reasons to invest in the company. It covers Google's diverse services, its financial performance, business strategy, and historical stock information, emphasizing its growth and expansion into new technologies like AI. The article also addresses common FAQs regarding Alphabet stock.

title: After Earnings, Is Meta Stock a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Morningstar assessed Meta Platforms' stock following its Q1 earnings report, maintaining a "Wide" economic moat rating but deeming the stock overvalued with a 2-star rating and a $400 fair value estimate. The article highlights Meta's strong core advertising business, driven by AI investments, but also points out the high uncertainty due to speculative AI initiatives and competition. Investors are advised to be comfortable with Meta's aggressive investment in new technologies, as regulatory risks and dependence on online advertising remain significant concerns.

title: Amazon sales surge as company trains focus on artificial intelligence
summary: Amazon reported record first-quarter sales, with revenue rising 13% to $143.3 billion and profit surging to $10.4 billion, exceeding Wall Street expectations. This growth was largely driven by a renewed focus on artificial intelligence, particularly in its cloud-computing unit, Amazon Web Services (AWS), which saw sales increase over 17%. CEO Andy Jassy highlighted AI as a critical building block for Amazon's future growth, aiming to generate "tens of billions of dollars" of revenue from it in the coming years.

title: Amazon signs lease for building at new Kannapolis industrial park
summary: Amazon has leased an industrial building of just over 198,000 square feet at a new industrial park under construction in Kannapolis, Charlotte region. This move signifies Amazon's continued expansion in the area. Related articles discuss other projects and developments by Amazon and industrial space in the region.

title: AEP faces 15 GW of new load, driven by Amazon, Google, other data centers: interim CEO Fowke
summary: American Electric Power (AEP) is facing a substantial increase in electricity demand, primarily driven by data centers from companies like Amazon and Google, projected to reach 15 GW by 2030. Interim CEO Ben Fowke noted this load growth is sparking discussions in Ohio about utilities potentially owning power plants again and highlighted AEP's intent to sue the EPA over new environmental regulations. The company anticipates requiring significant capital investments in transmission and generation to meet this rising demand while keeping rates affordable.

title: PSEG to explore selling nuclear power to data centers
summary: Public Service Enterprise Group (PSEG) is considering selling direct nuclear power to data centers from its plants in New Jersey, as revealed by CEO Ralph LaRossa. This initiative includes discussions for both mid-size data centers and co-located facilities, aiming to leverage nuclear power's reliability and carbon-free nature for the growing data center demand. PSEG is also seeking license renewals for its Salem and Hope Creek generating stations to extend their operational lives significantly.

title: Industrial Same-store NOI Saw Highest Increase of Reporting Sectors Through 2023
summary: The industrial REIT sector demonstrated strong operational performance through 2023, with year-over-year same-store net operating income increasing by 7.8%, the highest among reporting sectors. This growth occurred despite a softening in fundamentals like net absorption, driven by robust demand, especially from e-commerce giants like Amazon. Industrial REITs maintained high occupancy rates and attractive pricing compared to private real estate, indicating a favorable investment position.

title: Fairfax shopping center redevelopment on hold
summary: Federal Realty has put the redevelopment of its Pan Am Shopping Center in Fairfax on hold. The proposed project would have included 550 new residential units and involved the demolition of a retail building currently occupied by Micro Center and Michaels.

title: Brookfield’s Renewable Solutions to Power Data Centers
summary: Brookfield Renewable Partners LP is strategically positioning itself to meet the increasing electricity demand from data centers, leveraging its development pipeline and acquisition strategy to provide continuous power solutions. The company's Renewable Power & Transition arm manages a vast portfolio of renewable energy assets and has partnered with Microsoft Corp. to supply renewable energy from 2026 to 2030, expecting to generate well over 10 GW annually. This initiative addresses the AI boom's projected 70% annual increase in data center power demand through 2027 and the significant rise in global carbon emissions.

title: Adobe's Acrobat AI Assistant Is Available and Could Help Company Compete
summary: Adobe has launched its Acrobat AI Assistant, available to individual and enterprise users via a paid add-on subscription. This move positions Adobe to better compete with other big tech companies like Microsoft and Google in the artificial intelligence market. The AI Assistant aims to enhance document productivity and generate insights, contributing to Adobe's AI monetization strategy.

title: VTEX brings the power of digital commerce innovation to Barcelona, setting the trend of an industry estimated to exceed USD 750 bln by 2027
summary: VTEX, a leading composable commerce platform, is organizing its "VTEX Connect Europe" event in Barcelona on June 7th to convene digital commerce specialists. The event aims to provide industry professionals with specialized content, digital solutions, and market insights, as the global e-commerce market is projected to exceed USD 750 billion by 2027. World-class speakers from companies like LinkedIn, NASA, and Whirlpool will share insights on innovation, consumer behavior, and customer-centric strategies.

title: Constellation Energy to Pursue New Nuclear Power for Data Centers
summary: Constellation Energy, the largest nuclear power operator in the U.S., is exploring building new nuclear capacity at its existing reactor sites to power the increasing demand from data centers. This initiative addresses the significant power consumption of data centers, especially with the rise of AI, and aligns with sustainability goals by providing reliable, low-carbon energy. The company is in advanced talks with major tech firms and plans to perform due diligence for projects targeting 2026-2028.

title: Greenoaks Capital buys Coupang shares worth over $20 million
summary: Greenoaks Capital Partners LLC has significantly increased its stake in Coupang, Inc. (NYSE:CPNG) by purchasing shares valued at over $20 million across three transactions in May 2024. These acquisitions signal Greenoaks Capital's strong confidence in the e-commerce giant, which analysts anticipate will see sales growth this year. Coupang, often called "South Korea's Amazon," holds a market capitalization of $39.76 billion and boasts more cash than debt on its balance sheet.

title: Earnings call: RADCOM reports record revenue and strategic growth in Q1 2024
summary: RADCOM Limited (NASDAQ: RDCM) announced record Q1 2024 revenue of $14.1 million, a 17.5% increase year-over-year, marking its nineteenth consecutive quarter of revenue growth. The company reported its highest-ever cash reserves, renewed a multi-year contract with Rakuten Mobile, and raised its 2024 revenue guidance to between $57 million and $60 million. This growth is attributed to strategic investments in sales, marketing, R&D, and expansion of 5G solutions, despite broader industry budget cuts.

title: Arcadia Biosciences selling GoodWheat
summary: Above Food is set to acquire Arcadia Biosciences' high-fiber GoodWheat brand for $4 million, expanding its plant-based consumer product and specialty ingredient portfolios. Arcadia Biosciences sees this as a strategic partnership to scale its wheat IP and monetize its intellectual property while exploring other licensing and royalty streams. Despite a net loss in Q1 2024, the company saw increased revenues driven by GoodWheat sales and Zola coconut water.

title: This Top Dow ETF Is Crushing the Nasdaq and the S&P 500 Over the Last Month. Here's What That Means for the Market Rally.
summary: The article discusses the recent outperformance of the Dow Jones Industrial Average ETF (DIA) compared to the Nasdaq and S&P 500 over the last month. It suggests this trend indicates investors are becoming more defensive and rebalancing portfolios towards value and income, and away from growth stocks. The author recommends the SPDR Dow Industrial Average ETF as a low-cost option for investors seeking to increase exposure to blue-chip stocks and diversify beyond tech-heavy portfolios.

title: Big Short’s Michael Burry adds gold ETF as top Q1 allocation
summary: Michael Burry's Scion Asset Management made the Sprott Physical Gold Trust (PHYS) its top Q1 allocation, investing $7.6m and giving it a 7.4% portfolio position. This move came as Burry downsized US tech holdings, including Alphabet and Amazon, to invest in China software and clean energy stocks like Baidu and First Solar. The firm notably increased its gold exposure while shedding US tech and closing previous short bets against the S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 via ETFs.

title: FDLO: Low-Volatility ETF Beating Competitors
summary: The Fidelity Low Volatility Factor ETF (FDLO) invests in 125 stocks with relatively low historical price and earnings volatility. Since its inception, FDLO has lagged the S&P 500 but has outperformed other low-volatility ETFs. While its risk-adjusted returns compared to the benchmark are unconvincing, the ETF's relatively short track record makes a long-term potential assessment difficult.

title: Investing in Gold? Forget GLD, Buy PHYS Instead
summary: Michael Burry's Scion Asset Management recently invested in the Sprott Physical Gold Trust (PHYS) while divesting from major tech stocks, highlighting PHYS as a superior gold investment compared to GLD. The article details reasons for gold's rising appeal, including central bank purchases and investor safe-haven demand, and explains PHYS's advantages such as physical gold redemption rights, secure custody with the Royal Canadian Mint, and more favorable tax treatment for U.S. non-corporate investors.

title: Shipping carrier diversification benefits Lulus in Q1
summary: Lulus Fashion Lounge Holdings saw savings in Q1 by diversifying its base of shipping carriers, aimed at offsetting rising shipping costs and pressure from fuel surcharges. Despite a 17% decrease in total orders, the company's cost of revenue decreased nearly 16% year over year, contributing to efforts to optimize costs after reporting a $5.7 million net loss in Q1. The shift to multiple carriers allows Lulus to leverage a broader range of shipping options and rates, with executives previously projecting "seven-figure savings" from diversification actions.

title: Logistics giant moving ahead with more Sterling data center plans
summary: Prologis, a logistics giant, is advancing plans to redevelop two distribution warehouses in Sterling, Virginia, into data centers. This move is part of several similar projects the company has underway in the area, indicating a strategic shift towards the data center market in Northern Virginia. The properties targeted for redevelopment are located at 45121 and 45181 Global Plaza.

title: The Justice Department is suing Ticketmaster and Live Nation. What does that mean for concertgoers?
summary: The Justice Department is suing Live Nation Entertainment, alleging it operates as a monopoly controlling much of the U.S. ticket-selling market, thereby driving up prices and stifling competition. While the lawsuit aims to increase competition and potentially lower ticket prices for consumers, experts suggest changes will not be immediate due to the lengthy legal process. The 2022 uproar over Taylor Swift's Eras Tour ticket sales issues highlighted the company's dominance and contributed to the current legal action.

title: AWS and SAP Unlock New Innovation with Generative AI
summary: AWS and SAP have announced an expanded strategic collaboration to enhance cloud ERP experiences and integrate generative AI into enterprise applications. This partnership will make it easier for customers to adopt RISE with SAP on AWS, improve SAP workload performance, and leverage generative AI models from Amazon Bedrock within SAP AI Core. Additionally, SAP plans to use AWS chips like Graviton, Trainium, and Inferentia for future SAP Business AI offerings and has boosted performance for RISE with SAP on AWS.

title: Responding to growing demand, Duke Energy, Amazon, Google, Microsoft and Nucor execute agreements to accelerate clean energy options
summary: Duke Energy, in collaboration with Amazon, Google, Microsoft, and Nucor, announced agreements to develop innovative approaches for carbon-free energy generation and meet the future energy needs of large businesses in North and South Carolina. These agreements, detailed in Memorandums of Understanding, propose new rate structures called "Accelerating Clean Energy (ACE) tariffs" and a "Clean Transition Tariff (CTT)" to lower the long-term costs of clean energy technologies and accelerate grid decarbonization. These voluntary programs are designed to facilitate direct support for clean energy investments, enabling customers with large-scale energy needs to achieve their sustainability goals while ensuring protections for non-participating customers.

title: JBG Smith Launches Investment Management Platform for Affordable Housing
summary: JBG Smith has launched Leo Impact Capital, a new investment management platform focused on acquiring, operating, and preserving middle-income housing, particularly in the "missing middle" segment. This platform consolidates JBG Smith's previous workforce housing initiatives, including the Washington Housing Initiative Impact Pool, which has preserved approximately 3,000 affordable units in the D.C. area since 2018. Leo Impact Capital aims to address the rising rents in major markets like D.C. by providing affordable housing options in growing neighborhoods for individuals who do not qualify for housing subsidies but cannot afford average market rents.

title: Capitalizing on the U.S. Energy Surge with Natural Gas and Copper
summary: The article discusses the anticipated surge in U.S. electricity consumption, primarily driven by the rapid growth of AI and data centers, and its implications for natural gas and copper investments. Goldman Sachs forecasts a 2.4% rise in U.S. electricity demand from 2022 to 2030, with data centers contributing significantly. Natural gas is expected to meet 60% of this new demand, while copper is deemed essential for its role in both AI and clean energy technologies, making both commodities attractive investment opportunities.

title: TCW Transform 500 ETF Review and Aggregate Rating (VOTE)
summary: The TCW Transform 500 ETF (VOTE) has an aggregate rating of "Moderate Buy" and an aggregate price target of $80.22 based on analyst ratings for its underlying holdings. The ETF's portfolio includes major companies like NVIDIA, Apple, Microsoft, and Amazon, with a significant portion of the portfolio composed of companies covered by 861 analyst ratings in the past year. These ratings and price targets are derived by MarketBeat from individual stock ratings within the ETF's holdings.

title: After Earnings, Is Salesforce Stock a Buy, Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Morningstar has lowered its fair value estimate for Salesforce (CRM) to $285 per share from $300 after lower-than-expected Q1 revenue and guidance. Despite this, the stock is rated as undervalued with a 4-star rating, presenting a potential buying opportunity. The company maintains a wide economic moat due to switching costs and network effects, and its financial health is considered sound.

title: Norwegian Cruise Line migrates shoreside technology infrastructure to AWS
summary: Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. (NCLH) has completed a 15-month migration of its shoreside technology infrastructure to Amazon Web Services (AWS), moving over 100 applications and thousands of servers to the cloud. This move has improved performance, enabled acceleration of innovation, and allowed NCLH to handle record traffic volumes without issues. The company now plans to leverage AWS's AI, machine learning, and generative AI services to further enhance operations and prototype new services.

title: EBay to Stop Taking American Express After Fee Dispute
summary: EBay Inc. announced it will no longer accept American Express cards as a payment option starting August 17, citing "unacceptably high fees." American Express countered that its fees are comparable to other networks and believes eBay's decision is inconsistent with increasing competition. This move mirrors past disputes between major retailers like Amazon and Costco with credit card companies over transaction costs.

title: New Tech, Better Outcomes: Digital Shelf Labels Are a Win for Customers and Associates
summary: Walmart is expanding its use of digital shelf labels (DSLs) to 2,300 stores by 2026 after successful trials. This technology significantly improves efficiency for associates by streamlining price updates, stock replenishment, and online order fulfillment, reducing time spent on manual tasks. DSLs also enhance the customer experience through clear pricing and promote sustainability by helping reduce operational waste.

title: 'Cradle to Grave': Children's Clothing Company Carter's Sued in Digital Privacy Class Action
summary: Children's clothing retailer Carter's is facing a new digital privacy class action lawsuit. The suit alleges that Carter's violated California's "Trap and Trace Law" (California Penal Code § 638.51) by using TikTok software on its website, which purportedly deanonymizes consumer data without consent. This case is part of a broader trend of digital privacy class actions targeting companies' use of third-party software.

title: Private Cloud Compute: A new frontier for AI privacy in the cloud
summary: Apple introduces Private Cloud Compute (PCC), a new cloud intelligence system designed for private AI processing with Apple Intelligence. PCC extends Apple's industry-leading device security and privacy to the cloud, ensuring personal user data remains inaccessible to anyone but the user, including Apple. The system is built with custom Apple silicon and a hardened operating system, featuring stateless computation, enforceable guarantees, no privileged access, non-targetability, and verifiable transparency for security researchers.

title: Nuclear power is 'overblown' as an energy source for data centers, power company CEO says
summary: AES Corporation CEO Andrés Gluski states that the "euphoria" surrounding nuclear power as an energy source for data centers is "overblown" due to its high cost and long lead times for new projects. He emphasizes that renewables, supported by natural gas as a transition fuel, represent the future for powering data centers, citing major agreements between tech companies and renewable energy providers. Gluski also highlights the increasing role of battery storage in making 100% renewable energy feasible.

title: VCR: Fueled By Amazon, But Weighed Down By Tesla
summary: The Vanguard Consumer Discretionary ETF (VCR) is rated a "hold" due to key risk factors, despite Amazon being a dominant holding. The ETF, with $6.06 billion in AUM and 303 holdings, focuses on retail, auto manufacturers, and restaurants, but its returns have slightly lagged the S&P 500, partly due to Tesla's performance and potential consumer spending declines.

title: More than 15,000 Amazon contract drivers file legal claims asking for compensation for overtime and unpaid wages
summary: Over 15,000 Amazon contract drivers have filed arbitration claims against Amazon, alleging they were misclassified as independent contractors instead of employees, thus being denied minimum wage and overtime. The claims also seek reimbursement for expenses like mileage and cell phone usage. Lawyers stated that independent arbitration was pursued due to class action waivers in driver agreements.

title: Kohl’s expands in-store returns of online purchases in new partnership
summary: Kohl’s is expanding its in-store return service for online purchases through new partnerships with Inmar Post-Purchase Solutions and Narvar, introducing "The Return Drop @ Kohl’s." This initiative allows customers to return online merchandise from a broader range of retailers, including Carhartt, Hanes, and Levi’s, at its more than 1,100 stores without needing a box or label. The partnership aims to enhance customer convenience and provide operational efficiencies for participating brands.

title: Amazon is coming to former Weyerhaeuser campus
summary: Amazon will be leasing one of the two buildings in the former Weyerhaeuser campus in Federal Way, now known as Woodbridge Corporate Park. The e-commerce giant will occupy Building A, a 225,000 square-foot space. Property owner Industrial Realty Group (IRG) purchased the 430-acre site in 2016 and envisions the property becoming a vibrant, multi-tenant campus, generating substantial tax revenue and jobs.

title: Campbell Soup Company Enters Connected TV Marketing Channel
summary: Campbell's Snacks, a division of Campbell Soup Company, has launched into connected TV marketing through a partnership with Major League Soccer as an official snack sponsor. The campaign, supported by Albertsons Media Collective's Collective TV and Clinch’s omnichannel ad server, aims to boost sales across participating Albertsons stores. This move highlights a growing trend among manufacturers like Unilever and Mattel to leverage streaming platforms to connect with consumers and deepen brand relationships.

title: U.S. Sues Adobe Over Hard-to-Cancel Subscriptions (Published 2024)
summary: The Justice Department has sued Adobe, alleging that the company made it difficult for consumers to cancel software subscriptions by hiding expensive cancellation fees in fine print. This lawsuit is part of a broader regulatory effort against "hard-to-cancel" subscriptions and comes after similar actions against other tech giants. The suit names two Adobe executives as defendants and follows an FTC investigation into Adobe's practices.

title: The government's lawsuit against Adobe shows deceptive design is good for business—until it's not
summary: The Justice Department has filed a lawsuit against Adobe, alleging that its sign-up process employs deceptive design to lock consumers into hard-to-cancel "annual, paid monthly" subscriptions. The suit claims Adobe hides cancellation terms and imposes hefty early-termination fees, calling out these practices as "dark patterns" that prioritize profit over transparency. This action aligns with a broader government push, including by the FTC, to crack down on manipulative online design practices that trick users.

title: Constellation, Vistra and PSEG could be next to ink nuclear-data center supply deals: S&P
summary: S&P Global Ratings identifies Constellation Energy Group, PSEG Power, and Vistra as prime candidates to ink nuclear-data center supply deals, driven by rising electricity demand from data centers and higher power prices. These opportunities are modeled after Talen Energy's successful deal with Amazon Web Services, where data centers co-locate near nuclear plants to secure long-term power purchase agreements above wholesale rates. While beneficial for nuclear operators and data centers, regulators are urged to scrutinize the fairness of these arrangements for all grid customers.

title: Freight Technologies, Inc. Expands Business Relationship with Amazon Mexico
summary: Freight Technologies, Inc. (Fr8Tech) has expanded its business relationship with Amazon Mexico to include cross-border logistics operations, adding U.S.-Mexico shipping services to its existing domestic logistics management within Mexico. This expansion solidifies Fr8Tech's role as a key logistics partner in North America, leveraging its Fr8App platform to address the growing demands of international logistics. The company aims to provide efficiency and dependability for clients like Amazon through advanced technology and continuous infrastructure investment.

title: Target to Offer Select Shopify Brands Online and In Store, Expanding Its Marketplace
summary: Target is partnering with Shopify to expand its five-year-old marketplace, Target Plus, by offering a curated selection of Shopify brands online and in its brick-and-mortar stores. This collaboration aims to bring new, high-growth brands to Target's customers and enhance its e-commerce offerings in a competitive digital market. Shopify merchants will be able to apply to sell on Target Plus, providing consumers with a broader range of trusted products.

title: AEP, Exelon challenge PJM interconnection pact for Amazon data center at Talen nuclear plant
summary: American Electric Power and Exelon have filed a protest with FERC regarding an interconnection service agreement between PJM, Susquehanna Nuclear, and PPL Electric Utilities that would facilitate an Amazon data center next to Talen Energy's nuclear plant. They argue the agreement could shift up to $140 million in transmission costs to other PJM customers and sets a harmful precedent by allowing the data center to use the transmission system without paying for it. The utility companies are requesting a hearing or rejection of the non-conforming ISA, emphasizing concerns about "free rider" issues and potential impacts on PJM capacity markets.

title: Streaming Profits Are Tough to Find. Niche Movie and TV Platforms See a Way Forward
summary: As major streaming platforms struggle with subscriber churn and profitability, niche movie and TV platforms like Crunchyroll, Shudder, Acorn TV, and Cineverse are finding success by catering to highly engaged, specialized audiences. These smaller services emphasize loyalty and provide unique content that larger platforms often overlook, leveraging more cost-effective production models. While facing challenges in content volume and technology budgets compared to giants like Netflix, these niche streamers believe their focused approach fosters stronger subscriber retention and a sustainable business model in the competitive streaming landscape.

title: Does Amazon Prime Day matter?
summary: Amazon's Prime Day, now in its 10th year, remains a significant sales event for the company and its sellers, generating billions in revenue and serving as a crucial driver during an otherwise slow retail season. Despite increasing competition from other retailers like Target and Walmart, who offer their own sales events, industry experts anticipate Prime Day 2024 will continue to be strong if compelling discounts are offered. Brands are advised to strategically market their own discounts to capitalize on the increased online shopping activity during this period.

title: Amazon becomes the 5th U.S. company to reach $2 trillion in stock market value
summary: Amazon's market valuation reached $2.01 trillion, making it the fifth U.S. company to hit this milestone. The surge is largely attributed to investor enthusiasm for its artificial intelligence investments and the strong performance of its cloud computing unit, AWS. This valuation underscores Amazon's growing influence in the tech sector, alongside other trillion-dollar companies like Apple, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Alphabet.

title: Talen Energy defends interconnection agreement for Amazon data center at nuclear plant
summary: Talen Energy is defending its interconnection service agreement (ISA) with Amazon for a data center at its Susquehanna nuclear plant against a protest by AEP and Exelon at FERC. Talen argues that the protest is misguided and that the issues raised are not subject to FERC oversight as transmission is not implicated. Research firm ClearView Energy Partners believes the protest poses no significant risk to the agreement, nor will it deter other data centers from co-locating with generation facilities.

title: FTC Brings "Dark Patterns" Complaint Over Online Subscription and Cancellation Practices Against Company and Two Executives
summary: The FTC has filed a complaint against Adobe Inc. and two of its executives for alleged "dark patterns" in its online subscription and cancellation practices, claiming Adobe failed to clearly disclose material terms and made cancellations difficult. This action continues the FTC's trend of targeting both companies and responsible executives for deceptive subscription practices and indicates a sustained focus on individual accountability in consumer protection cases. The complaint seeks civil penalties, monetary relief, and permanent injunctions for all defendants.

title: Is AWS in Trouble?
summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is facing increased competition from Microsoft, particularly in AI, and appears to be responding with incentives like doubling startup credits and developing new AI chips. Despite AWS being crucial to Amazon's financial success and stock performance, its market leadership is being challenged. Amazon is working to maintain AWS as the top cloud service to justify its market valuation.

title: 'We are famously unprofitable': A 36-year-old Jeff Bezos on Amazon
summary: This article revisits a 2000 BBC interview with a 36-year-old Jeff Bezos, where he described Amazon as a "famously unprofitable company" due to its investment strategy amidst the dotcom bubble. It highlights Amazon's subsequent growth into a multi-trillion dollar company despite early losses and challenges, and also touches on Bezos's later career and philanthropic efforts. The piece reflects on how Amazon's early customer-first strategy and continuous expansion led to its current global dominance across various sectors.

title: Fortinet is an Undervalued Cybersecurity Stock Worth Owning
summary: Fortinet (NASDAQ: FTNT) is presented as an undervalued cybersecurity stock, specializing in unified SASE and serving large clients like Microsoft and Amazon. The company beat Q1 2024 EPS estimates and raised its full-year guidance, despite a decline in product revenue. Technical analysis shows FTNT attempting to break out of a bearish descending triangle pattern, with analysts currently holding a "Hold" rating.

title: 3 Reasons to Buy BULZ, and 4 Reasons Not To
summary: This article examines the MicroSectors Solactive FANG Innovation 3x Leveraged ETN (BULZ), outlining three reasons to consider investing in it and four reasons to be cautious. The ETN offers a concentrated, equal-weighted, and leveraged investment in top tech stocks, but comes with high volatility, potential for the underlying premise to fail, high expense ratios, and a warning from the issuer against long-term holding.

title: HepsiJet launches EVs to enhance sustainable delivery services
summary: HepsiJet, the last-mile delivery service of Turkish e-commerce platform Hepsiburada, has launched 21 electric vans in select regions of Türkiye to enhance its sustainable delivery services. This initiative aims to reduce carbon emissions by approximately 0.21 tons per 1,404 kilometers traveled per vehicle each month and is expected to expand to 50 electric vans by the end of 2024. The move supports the company's broader sustainability goals by creating an eco-friendly logistics network in major cities like Istanbul, Ankara, Izmir, Muğla, and Antalya.

title: Nano Dimension to Acquire Desktop Metal, Creating a Leader in Additive Manufacturing
summary: Nano Dimension announced its intent to acquire Desktop Metal in an all-cash transaction for $5.50 per share, potentially adjustable down to $4.07 per share. This merger aims to create a leader in additive manufacturing with complementary product offerings, a strong financial profile, and a focus on profitability and growth through greater scale. The combined entity expects to generate significant value by accelerating the shift to designed-for-manufacturing applications and expanding customer penetration across various high-growth industries.

title: Laird Superfood Protein Creamer
summary: Laird Superfood Inc. has launched its new Protein Creamer, a plant-based product containing 12 grams of protein per serving. This creamer, designed to blend smoothly into coffee or tea, features a mix of pea, hemp, and pumpkin seed proteins, MCTs, and the brand's Performance Mushroom Blend. The company highlights its suitability for the 30-30-30 rule and its commitment to clean ingredients.

title: Nike CFO Matthew Friend sells $889k in company stock
summary: Matthew Friend, Nike's CFO, sold 9,350 shares of the company's Class B Common Stock for a total of $889,185 on June 5, 2024. This transaction was conducted under a prearranged 10b5-1 trading plan. Despite the sale, Friend still retains a significant number of shares, and insider transactions are often monitored by investors for insights into company dynamics.

title: Twilio Under Investigation for Data Breach of Over 33 Million Authy MFA Users
summary: Schubert Jonckheer & Kolbe LLP is investigating a data breach affecting 33.4 million users of Twilio's Authy MFA app, where private data including phone numbers was accessed by third-party threat actors due to an unauthenticated API endpoint. The stolen data could be used for phishing, smishing, and SIM swapping attacks, and may enable further breaches. Additionally, Twilio is notifying customers about a separate breach involving an unsecured Amazon Web Services S3 bucket of a third-party vendor, which exposed SMS-related data.

title: What broadening rally? AI stocks dominate US market again in Q2
summary: AI stocks, particularly a select group of major tech companies, continued to dominate the US market rally in Q2 2024, contributing almost all of the Morningstar US Market Index's gains. This concentration of returns in AI-related large-cap growth stocks, led by Nvidia and Apple, indicates that the anticipated broadening of the stock market rally has not yet occurred. Other sectors and smaller capitalization stocks either showed minimal gains or detracted from overall market performance, while some AI-adjacent companies like Intel and Salesforce experienced significant drops.

title: Driving surge in demand for power, data centers eye Kentucky
summary: Kentucky is emerging as a potential location for new data centers driven by the artificial intelligence boom, with state lawmakers offering tax incentives and utilities preparing for increased power demand. However, this development raises concerns among environmental advocates regarding the financial burden on consumers for new infrastructure and the potential reliance on fossil fuels, as Kentucky currently has minimal renewable energy sources. The article highlights the significant power needs of data centers and the considerations for balancing economic growth with environmental impact.

title: Oxy, Microsoft clinch “record” carbon removal deal to handle AI-associated emissions
summary: Occidental Petroleum Corp. and Microsoft Corp. have finalized a record carbon removal deal, with Microsoft agreeing to purchase 500,000 metric tons of carbon credits from Occidental's Stratos plant. This agreement helps Microsoft address its growing emissions, particularly those associated with AI, and bolsters Occidental's direct air capture (DAC) technology efforts. Despite high costs and scalability challenges, the deal represents a significant investment in carbon removal, with Occidental planning to expand its DAC plant fleet.

title: Costco memberships set to increase for first time since 2017
summary: Costco is set to raise its membership fees for the first time in seven years, with standard memberships increasing by $5 to $65 and Executive Memberships by $10 to $130 annually, effective September 1. This move is expected to impact 52 million memberships and follows similar increases by rivals like Sam's Club and Amazon. The fee hikes contribute significantly to Costco's profits, helping to offset expenses and keep prices down, and come as the company reported a 7.4% increase in net sales for the five weeks ending July 7.

title: NetApp Expands Intelligent Data Infrastructure Capabilities to Power Strategic Cloud Workloads
summary: NetApp has introduced new capabilities for its intelligent data infrastructure to support strategic cloud workloads, including GenAI and VMware environments. These enhancements focus on reducing resources and risks for managing complex hybrid multicloud environments through unified data storage, integrated data services, and automated cloud operations. Key new features include NetApp BlueXP Workload Factory for AWS, NetApp GenAI Toolkit for Azure NetApp Files, and expanded support for Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP.

title: Intuit Slashes 1,800 Jobs in AI Embrace
summary: Intuit announced the elimination of 1,800 jobs, representing 10% of its workforce, as it deepens its use of AI in services like TurboTax and QuickBooks. However, the company plans to hire an equal number of new employees, primarily in engineering, product, and customer-facing roles, to support its AI-augmented strategy. Intuit CEO Sasan Goodarzi stated that the job cuts were not for cost-cutting but for strategic reinvestment in critical AI-driven areas.

title: AES Corp (AES) August 16 puts purchased as share price down 9.5%
summary: AES Corp (NYSE: AES) saw significant options activity with 3500 contracts of August 16 puts purchased for 40c as its share price dropped 9.5%. The company's 30-day implied volatility is at 42, within its 52-week range of 25 to 87. This trading action suggests increased bearish sentiment or hedging activity around AES.

title: Amazon Prime Day deals could lead to over $10B in gross merchandise volume: analysts
summary: Analysts from Jefferies predict that Amazon's Prime Day could generate over $10 billion in Gross Merchandise Volume (GMV), significantly boosting third-quarter earnings. Despite competition from rivals, Amazon's prices and shopping experience are noted as superior, and the company is enhancing Prime membership benefits with additional discounts. Jefferies maintains a Buy rating for Amazon with a $235 price target, indicating a potential 22% upside.

title: VCR: Consumer Discretionary Sector Dashboard For July (NYSEARCA:VCR)
summary: This monthly article series provides a dashboard with aggregate subsector metrics in the Consumer Discretionary sector, highlighting that consumer services are the most attractive subsector based on value and quality scores. It also points out that the auto and components industry is below its baseline for both scores. The article suggests Vanguard Consumer Discretionary Index Fund ETF Shares (VCR) as an alternative to XLY and identifies nine stocks that were cheaper than their peers in July 2024.

title: This Cybersecurity Stock Gains Analysts' Favor for Strong Growth
summary: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is gaining favor among Wall Street analysts due to its strong financial performance, leading position in the cybersecurity space, and optimistic growth projections. The company's significant revenue and subscription growth, coupled with strong free cash flow and high gross margins, are driving bullish price targets from firms like Loop Capital, Evercore, and Mizuho. Analysts see Datadog as a leader compared to peers like Zscaler and Fortinet, with substantial EPS growth expectations.

title: Amazon Prime Day Drives Online Sales Up 11% to $14.2 Billion
summary: Online sales during Amazon's 48-hour Prime Day event increased by 11% to $14.2 billion, according to Adobe Inc. U.S. shoppers leveraged deep discounts on electronics, apparel, and small home appliances. The average household spent $152, a slight decrease from the previous year, with top sellers including protein shakes and Amazon's Fire TV Stick.

title: WaterWorld - 3 Essential Stocks to Own During Market Rotation
summary: As the market experiences a rotation away from the technology sector, driven by anticipated interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve, investors are looking for new opportunities. This article highlights three stocks – SoFi Technologies (SOFI), CleanSpark (CLSK), and Waste Management (WM) – as essential holdings during this shift. Each company is presented with fundamental reasons and analyst projections supporting potential rallies, offering alternatives to high-flying tech stocks.

title: iRobot Is a Falling Knife That's Too Risky for Most
summary: Shares of iRobot have plummeted 95% since 2021, and the company faces significant challenges following its failed acquisition by Amazon. Management must contend with substantial debt payments due within the next three years, putting the company in a precarious financial position. Despite restructuring efforts, iRobot's business and financial woes make its shares a high-risk investment, best avoided by most investors.

title: World’s largest industrial warehouse owner says customer demand is subdued but improving
summary: Prologis Inc., the world's largest industrial warehouse owner, reports that customer demand remains subdued but is improving, with expectations for this trend to continue as construction pipelines shrink. The company is actively investing in multi-story warehouses, EV charging depots, and diverse logistics facilities globally, despite a slight decrease in new construction projections and a dip in second-quarter net earnings. Prologis also engages in strategic acquisitions and partnerships, focusing on innovative solutions for customer pain points and exploring future opportunities in data centers and energy facilities.

title: Silicon Valley firm buys 3 Philippine data centers
summary: Equinix, a Silicon Valley-based digital infrastructure company, is expanding its presence in the Asia-Pacific region by acquiring three data centers in the Philippines from Total Information Management (TIM). This move aims to cater to the increasing demand for data storage driven by emerging technologies like AI and hyperscalers, with the acquired facilities adding over 1,000 cabinets to Equinix's capacity. The acquisition also positions Equinix to further expand into other new markets like Jakarta and Chennai.

title: Bitcoin Rewards Company Fold to Go Public on Nasdaq Via SPAC Merger
summary: Bitcoin rewards company Fold is preparing to go public on the Nasdaq stock exchange through a merger with FTAC Emerald Acquisition Corp., a special-purpose acquisition company (SPAC). This deal values Fold at $365 million and will make it the first publicly traded financial services company powered by Bitcoin, with over 1,000 BTC in its treasury. Fold offers users Bitcoin cashback for everyday purchases and plans to use the merger proceeds to expand its treasury operations.

title: AES Maximo robot designed to save time and money for solar panel installation
summary: AES Corp. introduced Maximo, an AI-powered robot designed to accelerate solar panel installation, aiming to halve the cost and time compared to traditional methods. With solar demand surging, driven partly by AI and data centers, Maximo is intended to work alongside human teams to boost efficiency, safety, and scalability. The robot has already installed nearly 10 MW of solar and is projected to install 100 MW by 2025, with major deployments planned for large-scale projects, including those benefiting Amazon.

title: Robots Are Coming, and They’re on a Mission: Install Solar Panels (Published 2024)
summary: Energy companies, facing labor shortages, are increasingly turning to robots to accelerate the installation of solar panels. AES Corporation introduced Maximo, a robotic system designed to install solar panels much faster and at lower cost than human workers, with plans for deployment in California. This trend aims to overcome construction bottlenecks and speed up solar power deployment to meet growing electricity needs and combat global warming.

title: AES launches AI-enabled solar installation robot Maximo
summary: AES Corporation has introduced Maximo, an AI-enabled robot designed to install solar panels with significantly increased efficiency, capable of halving installation time and costs. Maximo is projected to install 100 MW by 2025 and will assist in deploying up to 5 GW of AES's solar projects over the next three years, including the Bellefield solar-plus-storage project for Amazon. This innovation aims to address the rising demand for renewable energy, especially from AI and data centers.

title: StubHub Faces Lawsuit from D.C. Attorney General Over Deceptive Fees and Inflated Ticket Pricing
summary: Washington, D.C.’s Attorney General, Brian Schwalb, has filed a lawsuit against StubHub for deceptive pricing practices, specifically "drip pricing." The lawsuit alleges that StubHub advertises low ticket prices that significantly increase due to hidden "fulfillment and service" fees revealed only at the end of the purchasing process, sometimes by over 40%. The Attorney General is seeking a court order to mandate upfront disclosure of all mandatory fees and disgorgement of over $100 million in profits gained from these hidden charges.

title: AES debuts Maximo, the solar installation robot
summary: AES has introduced Maximo, an AI-powered robot designed to enhance solar installation speed, efficiency, and safety by automating heavy lifting for module placement. Maximo has already installed nearly 10 MW of solar and is projected to install 100 MW by 2025, aiming to accelerate the deployment of gigawatts of solar projects, including the 2 GW Bellefield project. The company emphasizes that the robot works alongside human crews to meet the rapidly increasing demand for solar energy.

title: This Could Be a Buying Opportunity for Active ETF ‘LSGR’
summary: The article suggests that the recent slump in tech stocks could present a buying opportunity for the Natixis Loomis Sayles Focused Growth ETF (LSGR). LSGR is an actively managed ETF focusing on U.S. large-cap growth with a long-term, private equity ownership perspective, and it has outperformed the Russell 1000 Growth index since its inception. The fund holds a concentrated portfolio of high-quality businesses and has recently seen significant net flows, appealing to investors looking to increase their active ETF ownership.

title: Earnings roundup: 2Q profits down at Alamo Group, Rush Enterprises; Toyota helped by exchange rate
summary: This earnings roundup details the second-quarter financial results for several companies, showing a decline in profits for Alamo Group Inc. and Rush Enterprises Inc. due to various factors like sales dips and increased costs. In contrast, Toyota Motor Corp. saw profit growth aided by a favorable exchange rate, while other companies like Amazon and Wingstop reported significant gains. The article also covers earnings from Denny's, Boeing, Sysco, Spirit Airlines, and Union Pacific.

title: Talen Energy to respond as regulator seeks details on proposed changes
summary: Talen Energy announced it would collaborate with utility companies, PJM Interconnection, and PPL Electric Utilities to address an inquiry from the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC). FERC deemed PJM's request to amend an agreement concerning Susquehanna Nuclear and PPL Electric Utilities incomplete, seeking more details. The proposed amendment aims to increase the load at Talen's data center at the Susquehanna nuclear power plant, a move challenged by other utilities due to potential cost shifts to ratepayers.

title: The Race to Displace: How Temu and Shein are Redefining Ecommerce
summary: Chinese ecommerce giants Temu and Shein are rapidly gaining market share in the U.S., challenging Amazon's dominance through aggressive advertising, optimized sales tactics, and innovative customer engagement strategies. They achieve this by making shopping fun with gamified elements, personalized catalogs, and influencer partnerships, despite high customer acquisition costs. Legacy retailers can learn from these newcomers' approaches to targeted advertising, sales tactics, and customer loyalty to enhance their own strategies.

title: Walmart leads the top 10 US retailers by sales
summary: Walmart leads the US retail market by total sales, with $533.96 billion in 2023, while Amazon ranks second with $250.11 billion. Although Amazon dominates online sales, Walmart is rapidly growing its e-commerce business and expects higher retail e-commerce sales growth and increased retail media ad revenue compared to Amazon this year. The article highlights Walmart's strategies to narrow the online sales gap through investments in automated warehouses and marketplace expansion.

title: Artificial Intelligence (Ai) In The Education Sector Market size is set to grow by USD 2.32 billion from 2024-2028, Growing emphasis on customized learning paths using ai boost the market, Technavio
summary: The global Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the education sector market is projected to grow by USD 2.32 billion from 2024-2028, achieving a CAGR of approximately 52.65%. This growth is primarily fueled by the increasing emphasis on customized learning paths through AI, particularly with the expanding use of AI chatbots. However, the high costs associated with developing and maintaining AI solutions present a significant challenge to broader adoption.

title: The S&P 500’s largest stocks are now cheaper, and Amazon shines by this metric
summary: The article discusses how the largest stocks in the S&P 500 have become cheaper, with Amazon.com Inc. being a prime example. Amazon's stock now trades at a more attractive forward price-to-earnings ratio compared to other large companies, a notable change given its historical high valuations due to heavy investments. The piece highlights how forward P/E and price-to-sales valuations have shifted for major U.S. publicly traded companies during the recent stock market decline.

title: The S&P 500’s largest stocks are now cheaper, and Amazon shines by this metric
summary: The article highlights that the largest stocks in the S&P 500 have become cheaper, with Amazon.com Inc. notably shining by specific metrics. Despite its history of heavy investments and relatively low profits, Amazon's stock now trades at a forward price-to-earnings ratio that is more competitive compared to other large companies, especially after recent market declines. The piece suggests that Amazon's valuation based on expected earnings and sales has become more attractive.

title: Texas power producers weigh in on tightening energy markets, load growth
summary: Texas-based power producers NRG Energy and Vistra anticipate significant opportunities from increasing demand driven by data centers, electrification, and new manufacturing, particularly within the ERCOT market. Both companies are pursuing solutions like co-location opportunities, new gas plant construction, and leveraging the Texas Energy Fund to address projected supply gaps and tightening energy markets, despite challenges like supply chain constraints and long lead times for equipment. They are actively strategizing to meet the rapid load growth, with NRG applying for loans for over 1,500 MW of capacity and Vistra planning to add up to 2,000 MW of natural gas-fired capacity and converting a coal plant to natural gas.

title: Veritone Signs Up for AI Collaboration With AWS
summary: Veritone Inc. has signed a three-year collaboration agreement with Amazon Web Services (AWS), making AWS its preferred cloud provider. The partnership aims to accelerate cloud-native enterprise AI and generative AI innovation for customers across various sectors, including media, entertainment, and public sectors. Veritone is a founding member of the Generative AI Center of Excellence for AWS Partners and an AWS Advanced Tier Services Partner.

title: Stop Experimenting with AV1, Start Working with it on Beamr Cloud
summary: Beamr Imaging Ltd. announced that its Beamr Cloud service now supports automated and scalable modernization of video to the AV1 format, addressing a significant challenge in the video industry. This upgrade allows for simpler, quality-preserving transformation from legacy formats to AV1, leading to more efficient and smaller video files, especially beneficial for cloud users and machine learning workflows. The company highlights that AV1 files optimized with Beamr Cloud can be up to four times smaller than legacy formats while maintaining the same quality.

title: Humanoid Helpers of the Future
summary: Morgan Stanley research predicts the humanoid robot market could reach a $357 billion impact on wages by 2040, expecting 8 million working humanoids in the U.S., rising to 63 million by 2050. These advanced robots, powered by generative AI, are seen as a solution to labor shortages, particularly in hazardous or repetitive industries, potentially disrupting 75% of occupations and 40% of employees with a $3 trillion payroll impact. The commercialization of humanoids is anticipated to accelerate faster than autonomous vehicles due to their ability to operate in controlled environments, presenting investment opportunities in their development and the underlying AI and mechanical components.

title: Instacart Stock Gains Momentum with Profits and AI-Powered Carts
summary: Instacart (Maplebear Inc.) is experiencing strong momentum due to profit growth, exceeding Q2 2024 EPS and revenue guidance, and the introduction of innovative AI-powered Caper Carts for in-store shopping. The company is actively expanding its services beyond delivery to include advertising, affordability initiatives, and business customer solutions, while maintaining a "Moderate Buy" analyst rating.

title: GenAI-Powered Asynchronous Messaging, Available 24 x 7, Caters to Modern Customer Expectations While Reducing Operational Costs
summary: TELUS International has launched TELUS Expert Messaging, a GenAI-powered asynchronous messaging tool integrated into the My TELUS app, aiming to transform customer service by eliminating wait times and offering 24/7 support. The service allows customers to engage at their convenience, while also enhancing operational efficiency and customer satisfaction for media and communications companies. Developed in partnership with WillowTree and utilizing Engage by Local Measure on AWS, this solution emphasizes data privacy and ethical AI use.

title: It’s Not Just Warren Buffett; We Also Think Ulta Beauty Is a Buy
summary: Morningstar sees Ulta Beauty as a strong investment opportunity despite competitive pressures, aligning with Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc.'s recent share purchase. The company's stock, though recently hit, is considered undervalued with a fair value estimate of $405 per share due to its strong brand, customer loyalty, and strategic partnerships. Ulta's narrow economic moat, excellent financial health, and plans for international expansion support a positive outlook.

title: Harris Joins the FTC’s Food Fight Against Kroger-Albertsons Merger
summary: The article discusses Vice President Kamala Harris's stance on the Kroger-Albertsons merger, aligning with the FTC's efforts to block it due to concerns about rising grocery costs. The author argues that the FTC's objections are based on a narrow definition of the grocery market, ignoring significant players like Walmart, Amazon, and Costco, and that blocking the merger might ultimately harm consumers by preventing a stronger competitor against larger firms. The article suggests that increased food prices are more likely due to inflation than a lack of competition and criticizes the FTC's rationale regarding labor concerns and "food deserts."

title: Kartoon Studios Partners with LiveOne to Oversee Music On New Winnie-the-Pooh Productions
summary: Kartoon Studios has partnered with LiveOne to manage the music for its upcoming Winnie-the-Pooh animated productions, including a feature film, holiday specials, and a series set to premiere on Amazon Prime in 2025. This collaboration aims to create original music that appeals to a new generation, leveraging LiveOne's expertise in digital entertainment and live-streaming. The Winnie-the-Pooh franchise, now in the public domain, has generated over $80 billion in revenue, and this new venture is funded by $30 million in non-dilutive production financing.

title: AI Stock Eyes Early Buy Trigger As Profits Surge
summary: Powell Industries (POWL), an AI-related stock, is approaching an early buy trigger despite a recent midday dip. The company, which specializes in electrical energy management and data center solutions, saw its profits surge by 149%. This AI stock is currently an IBD 50 Stocks To Watch pick.

title: Why Legendary Investor Bill Miller Still Loves Bitcoin — And 3 Ways To Beat The Market
summary: Legendary investor Bill Miller III shares his continued bullishness on Bitcoin, detailing how he got into the cryptocurrency and why he views it as an insurance policy against financial catastrophe. The article also provides insights into his market-beating strategies over 15 years, emphasizing key lessons learned from past successes with Amazon and Dell and disappointments with Kodak. Miller discusses the importance of an analytical or behavioral edge in investing and recommends essential readings for aspiring investors.

title: Princess Polly to open new US stores
summary: A.k.a. Brands Holding Corp is set to open four new Princess Polly stores in the US during the back half of 2024. These new locations will include stores in Scottsdale, Santa Clara, and San Diego on the West Coast, and the brand's first East Coast store in Boston, Massachusetts, each offering over 250 apparel looks and more than 200 accessories and footwear styles. The stores will feature selfie mirrors, digital screens, and host exclusive influencer and customer-focused events to enhance community connection beyond the digital world.

title: Consumer Trends 2024: Investing in the Convenience Premium
summary: Consumers are increasingly prioritizing convenience in their purchasing decisions, a trend that is expected to benefit companies in hospitality, consumer staples, internet, media, and entertainment sectors. A Morgan Stanley Research AlphaWise survey indicates that 77% of U.S. consumers consider convenience a key factor, with many willing to pay up to 5% more for it.
